Desculpe, essa não é uma boa hora para falar.

Meu {reg59? senhora: Senhor}, o esconderijo de Sven era um lugar perigoso, mas conseguimos resgatar Bodo. Eu entendo que você queira encontrar sua mãe, mas deixe-me dizer quando eu estava no tribunal do jarl de Kennemer, ouvi coisas horríveis sobre Sigurd...
Meu {reg59? senhora: Senhor}, queremos que saiba que ninguém o culpa pelo que aconteceu no duelo e todos ainda te apoiam totalmente.
Partiremos quando estiver pronto.
Por favor, não desperdice mais do meu tempo hoje, {reg59? senhora: Senhor}. Talvez nos encontremos novamente em nossas viagens.
Um órfão veio me agradecer por ajudar sua família. Você é uma pessoa boa, {playername}! Você conseguiu me fazer sentir menos culpado e um pouco mais feliz.
Deu o dinheiro a Adda ?
Você se voltou por agora, mas certamente você continua interessado no esconderijo de Thiaderd...
Diga-me o que aconteceu desde que o Ric Woden foi atacado por Sven Pescoço de Touro.
Acalme-se. Seu pai, Thonkrik, me enviou para te encontrar.
Mantenha distância e me diga o que você quer.
Calma! Não sou seu inimigo. Eu vi você falando com rei Horik e te segui. Minhas mãos estão longe de minhas armas, e estou à sua mercê...
Eu não gosto quando alguém está me seguindo.
Obrigado, eu acho que te devo minha vida.
Obrigado, mas nenhuma ajuda era necessária com esses caras.
{s2} ^ ^ Eu também não! Eu sou Solveig, e eu escolhi servi-lo e protegê-lo enquanto você continuar digno.
{s2} ^ ^ Eram uns idiotas. Eles vinham te seguindo por dias e tiveram cem melhores oportunidades. No entanto, qualquer tempo escolhido teria sido um fracasso, porque eu estava pronta para salvá-lo.
{s2} ^ ^ Não se preocupe. Não direi a ninguém que tive que salvá-lo quando você estava com as calças para baixo.
Não tem medo de bandidos na estrada, viajando sozinho como você está?
Eu nunca esperaria ver um grego em Northvegr.
{s2} ^ ^ Bem, eu não estava sozinho e agora eu estou com você, e tenho certeza que os bandidos fugirão quando te virem.
{s2} ^ ^ Eu nunca esperei encontrar um Norwegian em Konstantinoupolis, mas lá estavam eles, ocupados levando-me à escravidão!
Do que você está falando? Foi você que enviou a mensagem sobre minha mãe?
Cale-se, escória! Então, você conhece minha mãe?

{s2} ^ ^ Sim, sim! Ela me enviou pra falar com você. Eu estava com ela... Quer dizer, eu fui seu servo, o escravo dela, quando os Danish de Sven Pescoço de Touro me aprisionaram. Sven é terrível! Eu tinha medo. Eu sempre pensava em fugir, mas estava tão assustado que eu sequer tentei.

{s2} ^ ^ Eu fui o escravo de sua mãe depois que os Danish me capturaram em East Engle há pouco mais de um mês. Ela não está bem, mas isso você já sabe. Ela está muito doente; está morrendo. Na maioria das vezes, ela não se lembra quem ela é e diz coisas estranhas. Os Vikings de Sven Pescoço de Touro acham que ela é uma seidr, alguém que tem espíritos, e eles a consultam sobre seus destinos. Sven se casou com ela porque acredita-se que melhora a sorte. Ele diz que quando capturar você, ele vai te sacrificar aos deuses, porque você tem o sangue de uma seidr.
Estou ouvindo.
Não estou interessado em Sven. Diga-me sobre minha mãe.

Sven Pescoço de Touro é um homem perturbado, e você se tornou sua obsessão por ter matado seu irmão, um homem chamado Olvir. Sua mãe previu a morte de Olvir por suas mãos, e Sven está com raiva de seu mestre, Sigurd Ragnarsson, já que foi ele quem enviou Olvir para onde você estava. ^ ^ Só conheço Sven um pouco. Ouvi que os homens dizem que ele foi um grande líder uma vez, um pastor de homens. Ao contrário, vi um homem que mantém lealdade através do medo.

Às vezes sua mãe podia lembrar e ser ela mesma. E então,  ela falava sobre você, {reg59? filha: filho} dela. Ela disse que você estava destinado à grandeza, e que seu destino está além do controle das Norns que enviou Sven. Só lamenta o fim dela estar próximo e que ela não vai te ver. ^ ^ Ela me disse para fugir, para encontrá-lo e lembrá-lo que o dia mais feliz de sua vida foi quando você veio ao mundo. Ela também me disse que se ela nunca te visse novamente, ela sempre estaria ao seu lado.
Onde ela está ?
Ela sempre foi uma mulher fraca. Onde está Sven?

Quando eu escapei, estávamos perto de Grantebrycge, mas isso foi há duas semanas, que é o que demorei pra te encontrar. A última coisa que ouvi foi que Sven Pescoço de Touro reuniu seus homens e os levou para seus navios pra estarem a serviço do rei.
Ele vai para Douar-an-Enez?
Eu entendo. Eu acho que sei onde eles foram.
O quê? Não faço ideia de quem seja Douar. Escute, não posso ficar aqui. Sua mãe me pediu para cuidar de ti, então eu vou com você.
Isso é fantástico! Ouça. Eu não posso ficar aqui. Sua mãe me pediu para cuidar de ti, então eu vou com você.
Tive que matar um companheiro e se juntar a uma frota de guerra. Agora tenho que levar um juiz junto?
Eu supus que a Assembly iria enviar alguém. Não pensei que seria você.
Um médico, é? Sim, você é bem-vindo. Vamos pôr nos trilhos e se juntar à frota Viking.

{s2} ^ ^ A Assembly decidiu que eu o acompanhe, mas estou feliz por fazê-lo. Não é minha intenção te controlar, mas devo garantir que você se junte à frota e vá a Englaland. Desse momento em diante, eu gostaria que me visse como um companheiro, como o médico que seus homens precisam.
Tive que matar um companheiro e se juntar a uma frota de guerra. Agora tenho que levar um juiz junto?
Acho que não tenho escolha. Vamos pôr nos trilhos e se juntar à frota Viking.

{s2} ^ ^ Eu entendo que as coisas não têm sido fáceis, mas a Assembly é a lei. É isso que mantém o equilíbrio em cada parte da Danmark e até mesmo em todo o Reino. O que acha que teria acontecido sem a jurisdição da Assembly? Possivelmente uma guerra entre o rei Horik e Jarl Sigurd? Quem sabe, isso ainda possa ocorrer apesar da Assembly. Não seria a primeira vez. Honra e verdade são muito importantes na Danmark , e existem apenas duas maneiras de satisfazer seus requerimentos: com wergild ou sangue. A linha entre amizade e ódio entre dois vizinhos, compartilhando a terra é muito fina. Se a Assembly não existisse, centenas de homens morreriam todos os dias pela menor das reclamações.
A Assembly não foi justa comigo, não importa o bem que haja em evitar uma guerra.
Está bem. Vamos pôr nos trilhos e se juntar à frota Viking.

{s2} ^ ^ As decisões da Assembly não podem agradar a todos. Ouso eu dizer, que às vezes os julgamentos da Assembléia não têm a função de serem justos. Sua missão é manter ordem e equilíbrio, garantindo que os homens venham para a Assembléia para resolver conflitos em vez de matar uns aos outros.
Vamos pôr nos trilhos e se juntar à frota Viking.
Estou certo de que seremos bons amigos. Temos que ir para o porto de Ribe assim que você puder e pedir ao mestre do porto para se juntar à frota.
Como você chegou aqui?
Bodo... alguém mais sobreviveu ao ataque Viking?
Friese não me tratou bem também, especialmente o Jarl de Kennemer. Estou deixando esta terra, e você vem comigo.
Tome outra bebida e me diga por que você não deveria estar aqui, Reginhard.
Você não está morto ainda. Vou te salvar mais tarde..
Boa sorte, Bodo. Foi interessante viajar com você.
Nunca quis você ao meu lado, scitte.
Acho que o resgate não será possível, mas obrigado pelo pensamento gentil. Espero que nos encontrarmos na vida após a morte. Agora vá e resgate sua mãe, meu amigo.
(Você assiste enquanto os homens de Sigurd arrastam Bodo. O Cantábrio vira a cabeça de uma vez para olhar pra você antes de aceitar seu destino.)
{s2} ^ ^ Maldição! Esses Vikings quebraram o selo. Felizmente, a carta do rei Aldefonso foi criptografada. Espero que os Vikings não tenham sido capazes de resolver o mistério.

{s2} ^ ^ Quando você me deu para Sigurd 'Cobra no olho', pensei que era meu fim. Eu morreria em desgraça por ter trazido a morte para o Ric Woden e por não ser capaz de cumprir a missão do meu rei. Felizmente para mim, a letra do rei Aldefonso foi criptografada, então eu ainda estou vivo. Os Vikings não foram capazes de resolver o mistério e me trouxeram aqui para torturar e dizer-lhes o código antes da assembleia. Os Vikings não são imaginativos com tortura, mas eles são brutais. Acho que se você não tivesse vindo, não teria durado vivo por muito tempo.
Me desculpe por ter te dado para Sigurd, meu amigo. É um prazer ter você de volta.
Pensei que Sigurd iria matá-lo. Vejo que é mais forte do que eu pensava.
-Você tenta ler a carta....
-Você não sabe ler, então não consegue entender isso. Dê a carta para Bodo....
Me conte sobre esta carta, Bodo. Por que ela é tão importante?
{s2} ^ ^ Não se preocupe. Estou ciente da pressão que você sente em seus ombros e da preocupação que tens pela vida de sua mãe. O que importa agora é que estamos juntos e nós temos a carta.

Felizmente, eles precisavam de mim para descriptografar o documento. Se eu tivesse dado a eles o que queriam, eu estaria morto há muito tempo. Bem, eu não quero pensar sobre isso. Agora estamos juntos de novo e temos a carta.
-Você abre o pergaminho cuidadosamente, evitando tocar as manchas de sangue do Atli com os dedos. Você tenta ler a carta....
-Não sabe como ler, então você não pode entender isso. Dê a carta para Bodo....
Me conte sobre esta carta, Bodo. Por que ela é tão importante?
..--O texto é em latim, e fala sobre Noé e sua arca, com muitos comentários por um monge, mas nada que apareça relevantes....
Esta carta é importante e pode mudar tudo, mas preciso de sua ajuda para terminar minha missão. É hora de revelar esses segredos segredos...
O truque é ler a primeira palavra depois de cada período nas três primeiras linhas de cada parágrafo e ler as últimas palavras antes do período a seguir.

{s2} ^ ^ Aldefonso tornou-se rei muito recentemente, depois de herdar o trono de seu pai. Ele explica no início desta carta, que ele respeita o norte e continua os convênios de seu pai. Ele envia um mensageiro para Saxônia Ocidental...... e outro para Frankia. O Mar do Norte, ele diz, deve ser tornado seguro e os Vikings erradicados. Wessex é o melhor local fazer isso, devido à proximidade com Dinamarca
Por que o Reino das Astúrias estaria preocupada sobre com Vikings?
Vá direto ao ponto, Bodo.

{s2} ^ ^ meu Rei, Aldefonso, está particularmente preocupado com o dinamarquês, uns dos que liderou os ataques a seu reino no passado. Houve dois ataques particularmente preocupantes, que Rei Aldefonso não quer que se repita. O primeiro foi cerca de vinte e quatro anos atrás, durante o reinado do Rei Ranimiro, avô de Aldefonso, quando os Vikings foram vistos perto costa de Astúrias, com mais de 120 navios e 3000 homens. Ranimiro rapidamente reuniu seus homens na Cantábria e Astúrias e enviou mensagens para vir a Galécia, onde os Vikings desembarcaram para causar danos. Ranimiro era um rei guerreiro. Quando os Vikings chegaram, ele estava firmemente arraigado em uma fortaleza, então ele foi capaz de derrotá-los em batalha e queimar 70 navios.

Mesmo assim, outra grande expedição de Vikings veio dez anos atrás, no tempo do rei Ordonio, o pai do rei atual. A frota de quase 100 navios foi liderada por Bjorn Ironside e Haesten, filhos de Ragnar. Eles desembarcaram na Gallaecia, perto do túmulo de Santiago e causaram muitos danos, antes de serem expulsos. Depois que o Rei Ordonio começou a contatar outros reinos do Norte que tinha sido atacada por Vikings, também, especialmente a Frankia e a Saxônia Ocidental. Esta carta é o final de anos de esforços diplomáticos.

A carta diz que de acordo com o que foi prometido por seu pai, Aldefonso concorda em enviar 20 navios e 600 homens para a Saxônia Ocidental. Os homens são todos veteranos das guerras muçulmanas, totalmente equipados com armadura, espada, lança e escudo. Estes homens, juntan-se a Saxônia Ocidental com contribuições da Frankia, limpará o mar dos Vikings. A carta detalha a rota e as portas que esses homens usará na sua viagem para a Saxônia Ocidental e pede o rei muito nobre, Aetheired de Seaxna, para preparar o alojamento e comida para eles. Você vê a importância desta carta, e porque Sigurd Ragnarsson, ou qualquer líder Viking, por falar nisso, ia querer interceptá-lo?
Esta aliança pode prejudicar os interesses dos dinamarqueses e seu modo de vida.
Seiscentos homens veteranos permitiria Saxônia Ocidental conquistar outros reinos.
Eu prefiro que você me diga.
Honestamente, eu não me importo. Agora que temos a carta, é hora de voltar ao rei Horik.
Não, você não está me ouvindo. Este exército não é para ser usado para conquistar. É uma aliança com um único objetivo: limpar o mar do norte dos Vikings. Permita-me explicar.

Imagine que 600 homens veteranos de cada Reino fazem 1800 soldados, cujo único objetivo é exterminar os Vikings. Não estamos falando sobre uma imposição de camponês, mas sobre guerreiros profissionais, bem treinados e bem equipados. Este é um enorme ônus econômico para qualquer reino, mas se eles são bem liderados..--irmão do rei Aethelred, Aelfred, foi escolhido para isto... poderia libertar o mar do norte da tempestade que agora a atormenta. Portanto, a lcarta é importante para a minha missão, então Ragnarsson Sigurd fez todos os esforços para interceptá-lo. Se ele pode mostrar a carta na Assembleia e então demonstrar o perigo que representa para todos eles, a Assembleia fará Rei com a missão de impedir esta aliança.
Então vou dar a carta para o rei Horik, assim será ele que irá liderar os dinamarquêses.
Tudo bem. Nesse caso, vou dar a carta para Saxônia Ocidental.
Eu preciso ver o que a assembleia decidiu. Então eu decido. Salvá-lo por agora.
Esta carta é uma arma poderosa. Mantenha ela segura.

Se você entregar esta carta ao rei Horik ou qualquer outro homem do norte, ele irá usá-la para ganhar poder de destruir tudo o que meus reis conquistaram ao longo dos anos. Eu entendo que suas preocupações são agora a assembleia e sua mãe. Eu vou te ajudar com isso agora. Depois discutiremos a carta novamente.
Tudo bem, mas não acho que vou mudar minha decisão. Certamente ele a dará para os Vikings.
Tudo bem, mas não acho que vou mudar minha mente. Certamente ele a dará para Saxônia Ocidental.
Bem, vamos falar sobre a carta mais tarde.

Bem, nós dizemos ao Rei Horik que a carta foi destruída durante a luta com Atli Eiriksson. Ele terá que se preocupar com Sigurd 'Cobra no olho' usá-la na Assembleia. Isto irá garantir o seu apoio para sua causa.
Não quero perder mais tempo, mas sair desta caverna.

Sigurd 'Cobra no olho' foi no salão do jarl de Kennemer hidromel em mais de uma ocasião. Ele não é apenas um homem qualquer, meu {reg59? senhora: Senhor}! Você sabe que o jarl de Kennemer é um homem duro, mas ele tremia antes de Sigurd. Sigurd não diz muita coisa, ele nunca sorri, e seus olhos de serpente enfiam-te como se ele estivesse tentando ler seus pensamentos. Eu era apenas um escravo, mas ouvi coisas. As pessoas dizem que ele é o mais perigoso dos filhos de Ragnar, um homem que iria matá-lo só para tossir nas proximidades ou para estar em seu caminho no dia errado.
The beautiful Brunhild is right, {playername}. From what I know, Sigurd Ragnarsson is the kind of man that one should avoid. Unfortunately, he blocks our way...

I don't believe it is so bad. You can't trust the jarl of Kennemer, since he is an accomplished actor who uses every possible tool to try to manipulate others. If he saw an advantage in passing as timid before Sigurd, he would've done that. I would be very careful with him, as he's a man who smiles when you face him, and stabs you with a dagger when you turn. With Sigurd, at least, you always know where he is coming from.
Reginhard is talking without knowing him. I've heard things and seen things. Maybe Reginhard was too busy drinking or betraying someone. Sigurd is spiteful, never forgiving -- and never forgetting...
You have the gall, woman, to call me a drunk and traitor to my face! You know nothing about me! Watch your words, or you will have to watch your back.
Brunhild! Reginhard has had a hard life. Don't use what happened to Thiaderd against him.
Reginhard! Overcome your regrets and your past and never threaten a member of this party.
Am I with grown people or children? Silence both you, now! Bodo, what do you think?
Bodo, can you give me some advice about Sigurd?
I'm sorry, my {reg59?lady:lord}. I'm sorry, Reginhard. I let my temper get the best of me.
Yes, I see how things work now. I withdraw my threats, but she should watch her words.
We are at crossroads. Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' has what we need, and your mother's life is in danger. In my opinion, we should go and talk to him, even if it costs us our lives. We have no choice...
Maybe there is another way. There is a powerful man who hates Sigurd: King Horik Gottfredsson of Danmark, Sigurd's king.
Why does his king hate him, Brunhild?
Imagine what you propose. If you were to speak to King Horik, what would you say?
Well, I know only what I've heard. They are enemies. Maybe Sigurd wants to be king himself.
Sigurd would be stupid, then. King Horik could banish him, make him an outcast, and strip him of his lands by denouncing him for the slightest infraction at the Thing.
My knowledge is limited, but perhaps Sigurd is as powerful as the king himself. Or maybe King Horik doesn't want more wars in Danmark, after getting his throne after a long war with the other jarls.
Reginhard, what is this 'thing' you speak of?
Speak with Sigurd or tell King Horik? We have a difficult decision to make.
The Thing or the Assembly is a meeting of free men where disputes are solved and political decisions are made.

I think we should get the protection and support of King Horik. This will give us an advantage when talking to Sigurd and will force him to respect our lives. If King Horik helps us, you can legally claim your mother back.
Do not go straight to Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' now. It may cause the death of your mother, and perhaps you will lose track of Sven Bull Neck forever. Why not see whether King Horik will support us?

If I had to choose between going straight to Sigurd and getting myself killed or going to Horik and getting your mother killed, I wouldn't know what to say. You got me out of the hole where I was, so I'm fine with your choice whatever it is.
I need to think about it. Thank you, all. We have to continue our travels.

Sven Bull Neck came here after the attack. He left some of his men here with us, the prisoners. I also saw him sending ships on a mission to attack Friese. Then he went north. I think something or someone called him there. Rather, I have heard his men say this, but not everything they say is true.
I know you really want to ask if your mother is still alive, and where she is. Well, I have not told you everything. I need you to stay calm and listen to me carefully.
{s2}^^Sven Bull Neck didn't end up there by chance. Our boat was his goal, and we had a traitor on board...
What are you saying? What purpose? What traitor?
I could care less about all you have to say. I want to know what happened to my mother.
{s2}^^I told you to remain calm! I'll get to that shortly, but you should know this first...

{s2}^^What happened was my fault, {playername}. I was Sven Bull Neck's target, so we were attacked and so on. I commended my soul to Erudino, for I was willing to die, but the Vikings wanted me alive. Therefore, it was I who brought death to my family on the boat. My redemption is that Sven Bull Neck will die at my hands.
So YOU were the traitor?
This is all your fault. You have destroyed my life.
No, Sven Bull Neck is mine, and I will kill you if you cross my path.
{s2}^^You're not listening to me! I was the Sven's target. How can I betray myself?
{s2}^^I know, and I'm so sorry.
{s2}^^This is not the issue to deal with now... but I promised Erudino.

I was stupid. I believed that the Woden Ric was safe, but I was wrong. I was betrayed by its captain. The poor man thought that Sven Bull Neck would give him wealth. He was cheated, for, when the Vikings raided the Woden Ric, he was killed. Maybe that is the real reason why we stopped among those shipwrecks...
The Woden Ric captain betrayed me -- indeed, all of us -- but I do not begrudge him that. He was just an idiot, and this cost him his life.
He is lucky to be dead, because I would kill him myself. I hate traitors.
But why was Sven Bull Neck chasing you? Why were YOU his goal?
I'm still waiting to hear about my mother.
{s2}^^Little can be done in this regard.

I was Sven Bull Neck's target, as I had something very important in my hands, something so important that his lord, Sigurd Ragnarson, would kill for it. However, I myself did something terrible before the Viking assault, something I regret.

Your mother is alive. When I awoke, a prisoner on Sven Bull Neck's ship, your mother was next to me. We were the only survivors, or so I thought until you came to my rescue today. Your mother thinks you are dead, my friend.
What did you do?

I gave it to your mother! I thought that it was safer in her hands than in mine... Before you take any fatal action against me in justified anger, you should know that it saved her life, because the Vikings thought she was my master.

Do you understand? If not for that object, she probably would be dead now, like the rest of the people of the Woden Ric. Your mother's disease helped too, because the Vikings think that madness is a touch of the gods. Sven took your mother north with him and left me to my fate here, to be sold as a slave, because he thought she was my master and the object carrier. We must hurry, because when Sven Bull Neck discovers the truth, he will kill her.
Who are you, really, and what is so important to be so wanted by Sven and his lord, Sigurd?
Where has he taken my mother?

That's not important, but I will tell you that I'm not a common traveler. I was sent by the king of Asturias, and what I brought with me is a gift that could change the course of a war! We'll talk about this later. It is urgent now to find your mother. Sven Bull Neck was summoned by his lord, Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' Ragnarsson. Sigurd wants this object badly. He will interrogate your mother about it, because he thinks she has the information he needs. We must find Sigurd soon.

Sven Bull Neck was summoned by his lord, Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' Ragnarsson. Sigurd wants this object badly. He will interrogate your mother about it, because he thinks she has the information he needs. We must find Sigurd soon.
{s2}^^I am not sure that we have anything to talk about.
Alright, I will stay with you, but tell me why you should not be here.
Come on, Reginhard, I'm legitimate. Tell me why you should not be here.
Reginhard, take these 50 peningas. I know that times are bad and friends should help.
You're such an interesting person. What is your story? (Persuasion)

{s2}^^When my family died, I joined the rebels, tough and brave men who struggle to free us from the oppression of the Danish. I fought at their side, and I was happy because being with them, always busy and fearing death, made me forget what happened to my family.
Why are you no longer with them?
What can you tell me about your leader?
How can I find them?
You cannot find them. They do not want to be found. These men fear the jarl. Thiaderd only allows people he trusts to join.
I am trustworthy. Ask me anything you want.
I think you're playing with me, and I do not like it. I'm leaving.

{s3}^^Look at me and listen. There are many people having a hard time during this rebellion, particularly the many widows and orphans. There is a woman in Dorestad who collects donations to care for these widows and orphans. Go see her and help. I think you're a good person, but show me. Talk to this woman. Her name is Adda. You can find her in the shop on the wharf. Make a donation in my name. Maybe this will help my people see me with different eyes.
Bodo, remind me about your mission.
Yes, I was thinking about the letter, and I've made a decision.

Your memory is fragile, my friend. When we traveled in the Woden Ric, Sven Bull Neck attacked us to steal a letter that I had. That's where our history began. Sven stole the letter for Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye,' his jarl, but we recovered the letter in Northvegr. We pulled it from the hands of the corpse of Atli, the man whom Sigurd had ordered to protect the letter. Now the letter is in our possession, and we were waiting for the right time to take it to West Seaxe. This time has come.

I am very happy! Without you, I would not have gotten this far. The letter will coordinate the alliance between West Seaxe, Asturias and the Franks. These three kingdoms will gather together men and ships to cleanse the North Sea of Vikings. In fact, it is possible that the fleet of Asturias is about to be sent, because my mission has been delayed.
I would like to hear the opinions of my other companions before making a decision.
Now, hear my decision.
{playername}, I think you should listen to our opinion before deciding.
Sure.
No, I'm the leader and don't need your opinions.
I have nothing to say. I will listen to the others.
I submit to whatever {playername} chooses.
--He clears his throat to get the attention of all.--

Sorry, but I can't be impartial in this matter. My ancestors, my family, are Vikings. The gods have granted us victory upon victory, so that we may acquire fame and wealth. This invasion we have embarked upon is in the footsteps of the sons of Ragnar in Englaland. It is a rich, fertile land worth fighting for. The Danish understand that if you can seize something, it's yours. It is for the inhabitants of the land to defend it and be worthy adversaries.

The Danish are not beggars, and do not come asking for a piece of land. Danes do not ask for charity from the Saxons. We come with weapons in hand, ready to fight. If the Angles or Saxons defeat us, we will respect their victory, but if we prevail, the gods are with us and the fertile soil belongs to us. That is what I believe. If the Saxons and Franks come northward to fight and defeat the Danish, they are true warriors and the land is theirs.
Your opinion will weigh heavily in my decision, Asbjorn. Thank you.
This does not clarify anything.
All men have the right to live without having to worry about what the sea may bring.
I've said all I have to say. You have my support, whatever you decide. It doesn't matter anyway, as fate has already been written.
Whatever you decide, I'm taking my leave and going back to Odinsve. I've made good friends in this party, but I know that now we'll be at odds. Therefore, I leave while we are still all friends.

I am not as good as Asbjorn at speaking. I'm just a slave who escaped from the hands of a Danish jarl. You know what I think about the Danish, or rather certain Danes who occupy Kennemer. They come, kill and take what they want. If delivering the letter to West Seaxe means a safer North Sea, you have my support. If you deliver the letter to the Danish, on the other hand...
Your opinion evens my decision, Brunhild.
What? What would you do if I carry the letter to the Danish?
I'll stay by your side, even though I do not like your decision. I owe you too much and have spent too much time with you to do otherwise.
I will take another direction. I will not be part of what happens.
Well... well I do not know what to say. I'm fine here. I think I'll stay with you, choose what you want.
I'm not happy here. I'm sorry, but I must leave and find another person to follow.
You are very important to this group, Agathinos. I want you to follow us.
I see. We'll be better off without you.
{s2}^^Great! Then I'll stay.

It is my turn to speak. I have chosen you. I have followed you. I have fought beside you. Therefore, I think I know you better than most, {playername}. I am from Northvegr. We fought against the Danes often, and many other times we drank and laughed with them. They are like us: free men who choose to live out their fate. In Danmark or Northvegr, we have laws, but Englaland does not belong to anyone that matters. They are weak kingdoms with much wealth for the taking. You cannot put a treasure in plain sight of a man, not protect it and simply hope that he does not take it. If you're an idiot, why is it his fault?
Strength and Chaos? I love your idea, too, Solveig.
Rule by force is not fair and just brings chaos.
Chaos is good. I'll keep at your side no matter what happens. Too many things unite us.
Chaos is good. Sorry, but I don't fight against free men who have merely chosen to be Vikings.
{s2}^^I'm worried about all this. I thought you were on my side. We were to go to the king of West Seaxe together, but now I do not know. I sense doubt...
I have no doubt, Bodo. We will go together to the king of West Seaxe.
I have decided to give the letter to Rathbarth and the rest of Ragnar's sons.
{s2}^^I knew you would not fail me. Well, we must go to the king of West Seaxe as soon as possible!

--His face goes from bewilderment to uncontrolled fury.--^^What? Traitor! I trusted you, I considered you a friend, a brother. Not only have you failed me, but you're encouraging our enemies. After all we've been through, Sigurd and Sven triumph. Well, I will not stay idle. Farewell, {playername}, and hope we do not meet again... for your sake.

{s2}^^What? Traitor! I trusted you. We have our differences and do not always get along, but I thought you'd honor your word. Not only have you failed me, but you're encouraging our enemies. After all we've been through, Sigurd and Sven triumph. Well, I will not stay idle. Farewell, {playername}, and hope we do not meet again... for your sake.
As I say, the Norns weave the threads at will.
I guess this is farewell. I will be with my family, in Odinsve. Maybe in the future we see each other. I respect your decision, and I leave without rancor.
Well... well I am with you.
I'm not happy here, you know. I'm leaving. I think it is time to return to Konstantinoupolis.
You put me between a rock and a hard place, but I gave my word, and I will keep it. I follow you.

Sorry, but I don't fight against free men who have merely chosen to be Vikings. I said it, and I stand by it. It's time to find a new master. I hope you are treated well in West Seaxe, {reg59?my pretty:handsome}.
I think you're wrong, but I'm loyal to you and follow you wherever you go.
Our paths diverge, {playername}. Good luck. If you ever go through Friese, you might find me in my father's house... or maybe not.
Well... well I am with you.
I'm not happy here, you know. I'm leaving. I think it is time to return to Konstantinoupolis.
It's time to get back on track. We have a mission underway.
Ragnar's sons are in a difficult situation. Besieged by the Saxons, they can easily be destroyed. We need to talk about this.
That would end the Danish invasion. Then the alliance would not be necessary, right?
Very well. I will listen to you.
Yes, in part, but Danish attacks and Vikings raids have roots deeper than this one siege. Let me explain.

If you remember, {playername}, my king wants to put a stop to all the Vikings raids and safeguard his kingdom. Even if the Saxons may now force the sons of Ragnar locked in Snotingaham to surrender or kill them, there would still be other sons of Ragnar and other Danish men whose greed knows no limits. Perhaps the Saxons will get a few years of peace, adopt again old enmities with the Mercians, and forget about their alliance with the Franks and Asturians. Even so, the Danish would remain in Northhymbre, and Vikings would still infest the seas. After a few years, another leader would raise an army and would start this raiding and piracy all over again.
I think what you really fear is that the Saxons can do it without Asturias' help.
I think you're exaggerating. Gaed a wyrd swa hio scel!
The Saxons could also very well attack Northhymbre and push out the Danish.
I think the Danish will defeat the Saxons in Snotingaham and then continue south.
What are you getting at, Bodo?

You are clever, and you know me better than I thought, {playername}. My mission over the years has been to create and strengthen this alliance. Certainly, it affects me if that breaks. However, I want you to understand the full seriousness of this situation. I do not think I would exaggerate to call this a historical moment.
You've been in Danmark with me. Do you really believe your words? The Danish will send more men next year, and the year after.
Yes, this could happen... The Danish are people who stand up to the difficulties they face.
I ask you not to give my diplomatic letter to the Saxons just yet. First, we must resolve this siege situation, avoiding a battle if possible, because that would hurt my mission.
Honestly, without reinforcements, the Danish cannot be interested in fighting right now.
I am not sure what to do with the letter. Calm down.
I'll give it to the Saxons when I see fit.
I'll give it to the Danish when I see fit.
Do not worry, Bodo. I will follow your advice.
Yes, I think so, too, but I wanted to talk to you now.
When the time comes, we'll talk about this issue. Not now.
Well, I will not keep you any longer. Go see Bjorn Ironside Ragnarsson.
What happened was inevitable, my friend. It was him or you.

I understand the weight you carry on your shoulders, because I just experienced the same, after the massacre on the Woden Ric. I know no words can soothe you, but nobody expected Reginhard's betrayal. None of this is your fault.
Thank you for your words, but do not worry. I'm fine.
He deserved to die, and I'm not sorry.
I killed him... I do not think I can ever forgive myself. I'm a terrible person.
It seems that we should not worry about you; you are a person without feelings.
This isn't necessary. I thought you were someone strong, with fortitude.
{s2}^^Ignore him. He does not know how hard it can be.

{s2}^^My God, my God, I... I'm guilty, and I don't understand why you've forgiven me. I let Sigurd lie to me. I thought it was an opportunity to be happy with a house and a wife. So I blamed you for the death of Thiaderd, but the fault is really mine. I started it all when I betrayed him to the jarl of Kennemer. Everything I do, I do wrong, and now Egil is dead because of me. I deserve to die. Please kill me.

{s2}^^I do not understand all the tears. Reginhard betrayed us. I trusted him. Everybody trusted him. I thought he was a good guy, and what he did was spy for Sigurd. He sold us out for a house and a woman. Reginhard was a piece of shit and deserved his death.
Reginhard betrayed us. I trusted him. Everybody trusted him, but all he did was spy for Sigurd.
True, Reginhard was a piece of shit and deserved his death.
No, he was a desperate man who had lost everything.
The piece of shit is you, and I want you out of my party now. Go back to your father.
I'm glad you think the same. For a moment, I doubted your ability to lead us. We are traveling to a dangerous place, and we need you well. Now we can go on our way.
Desperate or not, he is a traitor. It is not worth spending another word on him. Let's go on our way.

{s2}^^Oh, to be sure, you won't! This is the best news I could have heard! I leave your pathetic little company to return to a true leader, a king, my father, Horik. I now leave you, save for my hope that they kill you in Englaland.
You are guilty, Reginhard. I spare your life, but get out of my sight forever.
Yes, you are guilty, and I'll grant your wish to die. --You kill Reginhard--.
Sigurd deceived you. It's not your fault. I have forgiven you.--.

Thank you for respecting my life. I understand your decision. If I may say so, you're a Soguligr, someone worth giving material to in the sagas. I hope someday in the future we can meet as friends, forget the bad and remember all the good from the time we spent together.^^{s2}

{s2}^^Thank you for respecting my life and forgiving me. This will never happen again. I will be faithful to you above all men. My life belongs to you. If I may say so, you're a Soguligr, someone worth giving material to in the sagas.
I am a trustworthy person, as you can see. Now, where are Thiaderd and his men hiding?

{s2}^^I betrayed them, so I'm here drowning my sorrows in mead. They were my brothers, my friend. I sold one of my brothers to the jarl of Kennemer for money! I sold Thiedold, our leader's brother. Now they want to kill me, and I am awaiting my death as a betrayer. Damn that day I fell for the jarl! Damned jarl!

Thiaderd? Don't you know him? I cannot describe in words what kind of a person he is. The men would die for him, it is true. The Danish are afraid because they know that someday Thiaderd will raise an army of Frisians and throw them out of our land.
Why? This is a secret I'm not willing to reveal.
Well, I wish to join them. I am a rebel!
I have a business proposal for Thiaderd. I'll pay 300 peningas to tell me where they are.
Your secrets shall be my secrets, even if I have to beat them out of you. (Power Strike)
If we talk to Thiaderd about this, surely they will understand and forgive you. (Persuasion)
Well, I understand. Let me return later with more money -- 300 peningas, for example.
They do not accept anyone they do not know.
Well, you seem to be a good person. I will take the money and join you, for I need to talk to him, too. Thiaderd is a man who values strength, so I suggest you bring your men.
{s2}^^Thank you, {playername}. You are right. I need to talk to them. I will join you. Thiaderd's hideout is in the mountains in the east. Let me show you the way.

{s2}^^You may be a joker, {playername}, but you are right. No secrets between us! Also, I need to talk to them and tell them that the jarl lied to me. I would rather die than continue here. I will join you. Thiaderd's hideout is in the mountains in the East. Let me show you the way.
You're welcome! Let's get going.
I guess we need a guide to the hideout, but then you might abandon us there.
My relationship with King Horik is... delicate. Taking you with me could cause me problems.

No, you misunderstand me. I serve King Horik, and when you talked to the king, I asked him to let me go with you. I need to make a name and gain reputation, and you need someone who can back you up with the king.
No, there's no place for you in my party.
Well, can you fight?

I see you do not understand anything, and that makes everything more difficult. King Horik wants me to go with you, and he is the king in these lands. You must obey his wishes. While you're in Danmark, I'll be with you. If anything happens to me, you'll have trouble with King Horik.
I see. He wants to have a spy among my men. I hope you know at least how to fight.
Your father wants you as far away as possible from the jarl, and I understand why. You are welcome.
Infelizmente não posso mais suportar mais bocas para alimentar em minha companhia no momento.
Infelizmente não posso mais suportar mais bocas para alimentar em minha companhia no momento.
Desculpe. Não posso pagar isso no momento
Nos veremos novamente.
Então... O que tem feito desde nosso último encontro?
Bom dia para você;
Pois não?
Minhas desculpas se fui rude mais cedo. Qual era sua história mesmo?
Deixa para lá.
Eu talvez possa ter alguma utilidade para você em minha companhia.
Vou avisar você se ouvir alguma coisa a respeito.
Ótimo! Me de alguns momentos até que eu esteja pronto.
My offer to rejoin you still stands, if you need me.

É bom ver que está viv{o/a}, {s5}! {s6}, e eu não sabia se você tinha sido capturad{o/a}, ou mort{o/a}, ou fugido. Eu tenho andado por ai desde aquele dia, procurando por você. Devo preparar meu equipamento e acompanhá-l{o/a}?
Eu vim para te tirar daqui.
Agradecer aos céus que você veio! No entanto, eu não vou em qualquer lugar com estas correntes nas minhas pernas. Você precisará obter a chave longe a guarda de alguma forma.
I look forward to traveling with you.
É bom ver você, {s21}! Para dizer a verdade, eu esperava encontrar com você.
{s5}. Would you want me to rejoin your shield wall?
Bem-vindo novamente, meu amigo!
Desculpe, não posso deixar que se una a mim no momemnto.
Bem... Me procure se mudar de ideia.
Então... Vai me querer de volta agora?

There is a matter that needs your attention. The quarrel between {s11} and {s12} has escalated to the point where it has become unseemly. If you do intervene, you risk offending one of the lords. However, if you do nothing, you risk appearing weak. Such are the burdens of kingship, {reg59?my lady:sire}.
{s1} no momento não tem um Lorde. Você pode deixar assim, pois os Lordes as vezes mudam para o lado onde há terras a disposição, mas, enquanto isso, as taxas deixaram de serem coletadas.

At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters that need your attention. I should point out though, sire, that I am not very skilled in the ways of politics, and that I am anxious to return to private life. If you wish to issue any but the most basic directives, I suggest appointing a trusted companion in my stead. In the meantime, is there anything you wish done?

If I may offer you a world of advice, my {reg59?lady:lord}, it seems that your right to rule as an independent monarch is not sufficiently recognized, and this may bring us problems further down the road. It may be advisable to find another kingdom with whom you have shared interests and seek its recognition, to establish yourself as an equal with the Northlands's other kings.
At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters that need your attention. Is there anything you wish done?
Haveria algo que você gostaria que fosse feito?
Do you have any ideas on how to strengthen our kingdom's unity?
I have acquired everything for {s4}'s gift.
Ah, let me take those. I hope that this will mend the quarrel between you two. You may wish to speak to {reg4?her:him}, and see if I had any success.
Vamos abandonar nosso plano de {s10}
Tem certeza que deseja descartar essa ideia?
Sim, tenho certeza. Vamos abandonar esta ideia.
Para falar a verdade, esqueça;
Eu quero enviar um emissário.
Eu quero acusar um vassalo desleal de traição.
Eu quero substituir {s4} como General.
Eu quero indicar um novo General.
You have just made such an appointment, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. If you countermand your decree so soon, there will be great confusion. We will need to wait a few days.
I want to reward you for your work as my advisor.
Thank you, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. What do you have in mind?
These bracelets and rings worth 2500 peningas.
I'll buy some slaves worth 5,000 peningas to help you with your tasks.
A beautiful estate valued at 10,000 peningas with a tenant who will pay you rent.
Oh, nothing. Let's get back to our tasks.
Thank you so much, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am happy to be at your service and now will be even more zealous in my duties.
Give me a report on the kingdom.
But of course, {reg59?my lady:sire}. I have it ready to present.
I want to send a message.
Certainly, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. We have a messenger ready at your disposal. To whom would you like to send the message? I've heard the following are nearby:
No, none of those. Later perhaps.
Very well. What do you wish to say?
Let me check my kingdom stock.
I wish to change the tax rate in my lands.
{reg59?Lady:Lord}, remember that a high level of taxes generates distrust and can cause riots, while a low rate may deplete the treasury. What would you like to do?
Set a high rate.
Set a low rate.
Set a medium rate.
Leave it as is.
The tax rate is {s11} now in all of your fiefs.
I want you to hire personnel to eradicate tax losses. Make sure they intimidate even you a bit.
To hire and keep this staff will cost 3,000 peningas per week. {reg59?My lady:My lord}, you must choose whether the new staff expense is worth the additional money they will collect for you.
I have decided. Hire the staff.
Very well, I've thought more about it. Let's avoid the new weekly expenditure, as it's too high...
Well, {reg59?my lady:sire}. From now on, your income taxes will be higher. I guarantee it.
Dismiss the staff working on tax loss mitigation.
Dismissing this staff means tax revenues will be reduced. Are you sure?
Yes, I cannot bear seeing so many peningas flying out of our coffers.
Ah, no. Let me think more about it.
Well, {reg59?my lady:sire}. They shall be dismissed.
Send a messenger to pay for the release of a prisoner.
Who should we pay the ransom for?^^Remember the prisoner should be in a prison so our messenger can find him.
Forget this.
How much ransom shall we offer? We must also add a messenger's salary of 400 peningas for the mission.
Three thousand peningas is a good number.
Eight thousand peningas would assure that the offer will be accepted.
Well, I want our subject back for sure. Offer them 15,000 peningas.
What? Even more money is necessary? Ye gods, let us think this over!
Well, a messenger will be sent to {s11} with your proposal to release {s10}.
I want a report on the piety of my subjects and new conversions.
Thanks.
I want to see the kingdom's coffers.
The money in your coffers currently amounts to {reg0} peningas.^^What do you wish to do?
Add 1000 peningas to the kingdom's coffers.
Add 5000 peningas to the kingdom's coffers.
Add 10000 peningas to the kingdom's coffers.
Withdraw 1000 peningas from the kingdom's coffers.
Withdraw 5000 peningas from the kingdom's coffers.
Withdraw 10000 peningas from the kingdom's coffers.
Nada.
Como vai a guerra?
Tell me more about the war with the {s1}.
É tudo o que eu queria saber. Obrigado.
I'd like to discuss training of men.
I can take your recruits and turn them into warriors.
I need some men in the garrison to be trained.
Stop training men here.
Deixa para lá.
Do you want me to use an alternative promotion when available?
Sim.
Não.
Alright, I will train the recruits in {s11}. Place the troops you want me to train at the bottom of the garrison list.
Yes, my {reg59?lady:lord}?
Eu quero que você não seja mais {o/a} Ministr{o/a}.
Quero que você se junte a minha companhia.
Eu desejo atribuir um feudo para um de meus vassalos.
Eu serei o novo Lorde de {s4};
Como desejar. Você será o novo Lorde de {s4};
Isso é tudo.
Quem deve ser {o/a} nov{o/a} General?
I shall be the marshal
Por alguns dias, não teremos um General.
Deixa para lá.
Whom do you wish to send this emissary to?
Infelizmente, não há ninguém para enviarmos agora.
Deixa para lá.
O que gostaria de dizer a {ele/ela}?
Que nossos dois reinos deveriam entrar em uma trégua.
Que eu desejo me colocar sobre seus cuidados, como seu vassalo.
Que eu desejo demonstrar minha boa vontade, de um monarca para outro.
Que eu declaro guerra contra ele.
Deixa para lá.
It is. I wish to make war on the {s12}.
Hmm. Talvez não.
Seu desejo é uma ordem. Estamos agora em guerra contra {s12}. Que os céus nos tragam a vitória.
Who shall be your emissary? You should choose the one who you trust, but who is also persuasive -- one who can negotiate without giving offense.
Na verdade, não consigo pensar em alguém.
Muito bem -- Mandaremos {s11} para {s12} e falar com {s14}.
Yes, do that.
Na verdade, espere um momento.
Very good. Who will you appoint in my stead?
Minha esposa, {s4}.
Na verdade, espere um momento;
Very good. {s9} is your new minister. I will rejoin you shortly.
Very good. {s9} is your new minister. It has been an honor serving you.
Which of your fiefs do you wish to grant?{s12}
Deixa para lá.
And whom will you choose to receive the fief?{s12}
Deixa para lá.
Muito bem - {s2} receberá {s1}.
Grim news, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. Who do you believe is planning to betray you?
Deixa para lá.

Think carefully on this, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. If you indict {s4} for treason unjustly, you may find others becoming nervous about serving you. On the other hand, if you truly believe that {reg4?she:he} is about to betray you, then perhaps it is best to move first, to secure control of {reg4?her:his} fortresses.
Eu pensei o suficiente. Valide a indicação!
Perhaps I should wait a little longer...
It has been sent, {reg59?my lady:my lord}.
{s12}Eu quero ter {s1}. (feudos: {s0})
{s66}, você deve ter {s1} por si mesmo. (feudos: {s0})
As you wish, {reg59?my lady:sire}. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg3?lady:lord} of {s1}.
Hmmm. Muito bem, {playername}. Eu valorizo seu advogado altamente. {reg6? I: {reg7? Você: {s11}}} será o novo {reg3? senhora: Senhor} de {s1}.
My God, My God, he's dead. We killed Thiaderd.

All right, {playername}, you've seen who the jarl is, and you know what he did. He only wants one thing -- the power -- and now he's using you to take it, as before he used me to reach my Thiaderd. For him, we are expendable tools, and the jarl of Kennemer will finish you off when you're either not useful or become dangerous, as he did with me.

The jarl of Kennemer is an ambitious and dangerous man, I admire your fortitude to bite him and help save Doccinga despite the consequences this has had. You are a good person.^^Friese can be hostile land for us now, but I'm sure we'll find our destiny elsewhere.

{reg59?My lady:Sir}, I have taken the liberty of sending a message to King Horik. I think it will be best if we have the support of some of the king's men, especially if you have any intention of killing Sven.^Well, I have not spent much time with you, but I think this could lead to a battle. I hope you will look well upon the initiative I took to invite the king's men to join us.
Yes, I think it was a good idea, Egil. Thanks.
No, I do not want you taking initiatives without asking me beforehand. Do you understand?
Egil, ask me before making a decision. I have all the information to avoid mistakes.
{s2}^^Yes, I know. I always make good decisions. I can be a leader as good as you, or better. Maybe you should let me lead this army some time.
{s2}^^Yes, I understand. You like to control everything. Well, it's your decision.
{s2}^^You're right. Forgive me. Sometimes I'm too impulsive. I do not want to jeopardize this party by my imprudence. I will consult with you about everything.
He hated you and decided to fight. He left us no choice.

{s2}^^Yes, he did not listen to me. The jarl deceived me, told me he wanted to meet Thiaderd to negotiate peace, but Thiaderd was smarter than I and told me it was a trap.^I insisted, and his brother accompanied me in secret to the meeting with the jarl. So... the Godi of the jarl sacrificed Thiaderd's brother with the Blood Eagle.
What is the Blood Eagle?
He died like a warrior. It's time to get going. The jarl of Kennemer waits for us.
He died like a warrior, but you live like a rat. Go give the news to the jarl and leave my party.
The Danish call it Blodugr Orn. They cut away all of the ribs from the spine, and then they rip out the living lungs to flap like eagle's wings.^It is horrible! I hope you never see it.
{s4}^^Then you work for the jarl of Kennemer... In the end, he got what he wanted. Wyrd bid ful araed. One cannot fight fate. Thiaderd is dead, and you are my new family.

{s4}^^Yes, I am a rat, but you aren't any better. You used me to get him. Thiaderd was a good man. His only sin was to revolt against the Danish and fight for freedom.^God forgive me! I accept my fate! Talk to your jarl. Later, when you tell me, I will leave your party. Gaed a wyrd swa hio scel!
Gaed a wyrd swa hio scel!
Fate goes ever as she shall!
I need him to find Sven Bull Neck.
I'm not interested in your opinion. See to preparing your things, for soon you'll leave.
{s2}^^There are always other ways that do not require that we submit to the will of others, but we'll talk later. A rider approaches from Doccinga.
{s2}^^I know, and my things are ready. You can kick me out anytime, but now you have other concerns. A rider approaches from Doccinga.
I did what I had to do. The jarl of Kennemer is a traitor, and I want him far from me.
If I had known I would lose all the jarl's confidence, I would have not helped Doccinga.
I do not want to talk right now, Reginhard. Excuse me.

{s2}^^I told you he is a snake. Now you are free from him, and we should leave Friese soon, as I fear that he will look for revenge. I have heard that in the Kingdom of Mierce, over the sea, they need warriors. Wyrd bid ful araed.
{s2}^^These are the words of a coward. I guess you're concerned and not thinking clearly. We'll talk later.
{s2}^^I understand. I'm by your side for what you need. Let us follow the path.
Excuse me, {s5}. There is something I need to tell you.
Para falar a verdade, {s21}
Muito bem. Pode partir.
Talvez eu possa persuadí-l{reg4?a:o} a mudar de ideia.
Thank you for listening to me.
Hm. Falando dessa maneira, acho que posso ficar um pouco mais, ver se as coisas melhoram.
Perdoe-me, mas não concordo com você. Estou de saída, queira você ou não.
Now is not the time to discuss these issues.
Oh... Certo... É sério?
Absolutely. You leave by my command or carried out on your shield. Which shall it be?
Não, estou brincando. Você está livre para partir.
Then this is farewell. Perhaps I'll see you around, {playername}.
Hm. Eu acho que vou ficar, então.
Thanks, I appreciate your opinion.
I hope that it won't happen again.
Sua opinião foi anotada. Agora volte à marcha.
{s11} é {reg11?uma valorosa membra:um valoroso membro} dessa companhia. Eu não quero que você fique brigando com {reg11?ela:ele}.
Diga a {s11} que você tem meu apoio nisso, e que {reg11?ela:ele} deveria ter mais cuidado com o que diz.
Não tenho tempo para essa discussão mesquinha. Não me aborreçam novamente com isso.
{s11} é {reg11?uma valorosa membra:um valoroso membro} dessa companhia. Eu não quero que você fique brigando com {reg11?ela:ele}.
Diga a {s11} que você tem meu apoio nisso, e que {reg11?ela:ele} deveria ter mais cuidado com o que diz.
Não tenho tempo para essa discussão mesquinha. Não me aborreçam novamente com isso.
Muito bem.
Obrigado.
Eu preferiria não discutir tais assuntos.
Conte-me mais.
Não temos tempo para conversar agora.
Eu prefiro que meus companheiros não me aborreçam com tais banalidades.
It has been an honour to fight for your cause, {reg65?madame:my lord}.
Sempre terá meu leal apoio, {reg65?minha senhora:meu senhor}.
I will miss living this life of adventure with you, but my duties await me. Farewell for now, {playername}. I hope I'll see you again soon.
Sua opinião foi anotada.
Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. I've been out spreading the word about your claim, and am now ready to rejoin the shield wall.
Well, {s21}, I've found you at last! {s11}. The rest of my report I submit to you in writing.
Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. I have returned from my mission to the {s31}. In general, I would say, {s14}.
In this letter, {s12} addresses you as {reg59?Lady:Lord} of the {s4}, which implies some sort of recognition that you are a sovereign and independent monarch.
In this letter, {s12} addresses you as {reg59?Lady:Lord} of {s4}, which implies some sort of recognition that you are a sovereign and independent monarch.
In his letter, {s12} merely refers to you as {playername}. {reg65?She:He} refused to acknowledge that you hold court in a former fief. This does not constitute recognition of your right to rule.

In his letter, {s12} merely refers to you as {playername}, omitting any title. This does not constitute recognition of your right to rule. {reg65?She:He} seemed nonplussed that you do not hold court anywhere.
Nessa carta, {s12} faz referência a você apenas como {playername}, omitindo títulos. Isso não constitui reconhecimento para seu direito de governar.
{s12} diz que sua proposta de trégua é suficiente.
{s12} says that he is willing to consider a truce.
{s12} diz que ele não está disposto a fazer paz.
Very well. Let this truce with the {s4} be concluded.
Pensando bem, talvez isso não seja do nosso interesse.
{s12} says that you have pledged to serve another ruler.
{s12} says that he does not believe you would honor your obligations as a vassal, and suspects that your offer is just a ploy.
{s12} diz que aceita sua oferta de vassalagem. Ele lhe garantiu 30 dias para procurá-lo, e nesse tempo ele vai cessar a guerra com você.
Diga a ele que eu aceito os termos que ele pede....
Saudações, {s21}. Está pronto para me receber?
Bem-vindo novamente, meu amigo!
Infelizmente não posso aceitá-lo de volta ainda.
Como desejar. Vou tratar de alguns negócios e tentarei novamente mais em alguns dias.
There! I can see the walls of {s3} in the distance. We've made it safely. Here, take this purse of {reg3} peningas, as I promised. I hope we can travel together again someday.
Sorry, I must take care of some business, but look me up again later... [ERROR- {s51}]
Minha senhora, eu espero ansiosamente por nosso casamento, assim que houver a oportunidade de organizar uma festa.
Minha senhora, se você deseja casar-se, podemos fazer isso no banquete em {s4} e trocar os votos diante dos lordes do reino.
Minha senhora, eu cansei de esperar que os lordes do reino se reúnam. Venha comigo para {s4} para trocarmos nossos votos.
Minha senhora, eu cansei de esperar que os lordes do reino se reúnam. Talvez devêssemos usar a primeira oportunidade de nos casarmos, em qualquer grande salão que estiver disponível para nós.
Minha senhora, eu cansei de esperar. Vamos nos casar imediatamente.
Minha senhora, meus olhos se regozijam ao vê-la. Podemos seguir com os votos.
My lady, with this assembly as my witness, I vow to take you as my wife, to honor, cherish, and protect you. May the heavens bless us with health, prosperity, and children.
Eu prometo te tomar como meu esposo.
Espere -- Preciso pensar sobre isso.
Somos agora marido e mulher. Que as festividades comecem!
Muito bem. Você me convenceu. Não tenho mais nada a dizer.
Well, {reg59?my lady:sir}! Please, do not trouble yourself to rise from the ground, as I would simply have to knock you down again. I shall take your silence as an apology. Good day to you.
Muito bem. Você me convenceu. Eu retiro o que disse, espero que esteja satisfeito.
Hah! Aonde está aquele galante de antes, hein? Não me encomode nunca mais.
Muito bem -- você venceu. Que todos aqui presentes sejam testemunhas de sua vitória sobre mim e que desisto de minhas pretensões com {s10}. Está satisfeito agora, seu bastardo cruel?

Levante-se. Que todos aqui presentes sejam testemunhas da minha vitória sobre você e que agora você deve abrir mão de suas pretensões com {s10}. Eu permitirei uma última visita, para se despedir. Depois disso, se tentar visitá-la novamente, todos saberão que você é um homem sem honra.
Very well. You've made your point. I apologize for what I did.
Hah! You lost, {playername}, so that settles it. Be gone now.
O que você quer?
Renda-se! Sua esperança foi perdida!
I demand your surrender in exchange for the {s11}'s safe return.
I offer an honorable agreement to end the siege. Pay us tribute, and we will go.
Nada. Nós deixaremos você em paz.
Surrender? It's a joke, right? You have very few men with which to storm the fortress.
Render-se? Hah! Podemos defender este castelo até que todos tenhamos morrido de velhice.
Não lhe darei nada. Renda-se agora ou prepare-se para morrer!
Bastardo. Vamos lutar com você até o último homem!
Você aguardará resgate e seus soldados viverão. Eu lhe dou minha palavra.
Muito bem, então. Sob estes termos, eu lhe ofereço minha rendição.
You have my word. You will not come under attack if you leave the fort.
Very well. Then we leave this fort to you. You may have won this day, but we'll meet again.
Unacceptable. I need hostages as guarantees.
Then we will defend this fort to the death. This parley is done.
We will not fall for your plot! We shall fight to the last man!
Our lord would never forgive us for accepting this deal. We must fight.
Well, we will leave {s12} to you in exchange for our lord. Proceed with the exchange.
Our lord would never forgive us for accepting this deal. We must fight.
I free your lord. Now leave {s12}.
Very well. Then we leave this place to you. You have won this day.
No, I have thought better of it and stay with our lord.
Then we defend this fort to the death. This parley is done.
Perhaps... we can make a financial arrangement.
Tribute? Hah! I laugh in your face. You will not get anything from here.
Pay now or prepare to die!
Bastardo. Vamos lutar com você até o último homem!
I see that we have reached an agreement. I demand {s4} peningas.
All I can offer you is {s4} peningas in coins, rings, and other treasures.
I see. Then bring the treasure now, and we'll go.
That is a ridiculously small sum. You're laughing at me, and you'll pay dearly.
Muito bem.
I've come to get you out of here.
Never mind. Just stay quiet.
Thank the heavens! I don't know how much longer I could last in here.

Wait, how will we escape? The garrison will rush us the moment we step out that door. I can try to help you hold them off, but I'll tell you now, they have fed me nothing but watery porridge and a few scraps, and I'm not as strong as I could be.
You keep well behind me and try to stay out of the fighting.
Preciso que pegue uma arma e me ajude, apesar da sua fraqueza.
Na verdade, não se envolva nisso.
Vamos!{s14}
Estou em dívidas com você por me libertar, amigo.
You're not going anywhere, 'friend.' You're my prisoner now.
I'll have your head on a spear for this, you bastard! Someday!
Você esta livre para ir aonde quiser, senhor.
Thank you, good {reg59?lady:sire}. I never forget someone who's done me a good turn.
Você é meu prisioneiro agora.
Estou a sua merce.
Você lutou bem, está livre para ir.
{playername}!
Alto!
Nós vamos lutar até o fim!
Espere! Há algo que preciso discutir com você em privacidade.
Não há algum jeito para evitar essa batalha? Não desejo lutar com você.
Não ataque! Nós nos rendemos.
Lhe devo um favor, não é mesmo? Pois bem... Permitirei que você parta, mas somente desta vez.
Aguardo seu conselho, {playername}.
Eu conheço você?
Meu nome é {playername}. Ao seu dispor.
Eu sou {playername}. Talvez tenha ouvido falar de meus feitos.
I thought {s11} ruled the {s12}.
Greetings, {playername}!
Qual é mesmo sua história, {reg65?minha senhora:meu senhor}?
Eu direi.
Eu quero apoiar sua causa e ajudar a reconquistar seu trono.
When I finish with Sven Bull Neck, maybe I will take up your cause and help you reclaim your throne!
Preciso partir agora.

Tem certeza que estará a altura de tal tarefa, {playername}? Recuperar meu trono não será algo simples. Todos os lordes de nosso reino fizeram juramentos de fidelidade a {s11}. Tais juramentos a um usurpador são, é claro, inválidos, e podemos esperar que alguns lordes nos apoiem, mas será uma difícil e desafiadora luta que teremos pela frente.
Estou pronto para essa luta.
Você tem razão. Talvez eu deva pensar um pouco mais sobre isso.

I have no doubt that your support for my cause is heartfelt, {playername}, and I am grateful to you for it, but I don't think we have much of a chance of success. If you can gain renown in the battlefield and make a name for yourself as a great commander, then our friends would not hesitate to join our cause, and our enemies would be wary to take up arms against us. When that time comes, I will come with you gladly. Until that time, it will be wiser not to openly challenge the usurper, {s11}.
Haven't you already taken up the cause of {s17}? You must have a very strong sense of justice, indeed. No thank you. I will not be part of your game.

{playername}, you are already oath-bound to serve {s15}. As such, I cannot allow you to take up my cause and let my enemies claim that I am but a mere puppet of the {s16}. No, if I am to have the throne of the {s17}, I must do it due to the righteousness of my cause and the support of my subjects alone. If you want to help me, you must first free yourself of your oath to {s15}.
You are a monarch in your own right, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. If you were to back me, I would be merely your puppet.

You are a capable warrior, {playername}, and I am sure with your renown as a commander, and my righteous cause, the nobles and the good people of the {s12} will flock to our support. The time is ripe for us to act! I will come with you, and together, we will topple the usurper {s11} and take the throne from his bloodied hands. But first, you must give me your oath of homage and accept me as your liege {reg65?lady:lord}.
I am ready to pledge myself to your cause, {reg3?my lady:my lord}.
Vamos aguardar pelo momento um pouco mais.
Então, avante! Nossa primeira tarefa é tomar uma fortaleza e persuadir outros lordes a apoiar nossa causa. Você quem mostra o caminho!
Adeus e até logo.
Eu ouvi falar que você fez amizade com {s43} chamado {s6}. Acredite em mim, você não pode confiar naquele homem. Você não deveria dar atenção a ele.
{s65}, eu garanto que não sou amigo de {s6};
Bom saber, {playername}. Caso contrário eu ficaria preocupado com sua segurança. Se por acaso encontrar {s6} novamente, fique atento e não acredite em uma única palavra que ele disser.
{s6} is an honourable man. You've no right to speak of him thus.
Como quiser, {playername}. Um tolo você pode ser, mas um tolo leal pelo menos. No entanto, a lealdade de {s6} pode não ser tão firme.
Não quero me envolver em sua desavença com {s6}.
Humph. As you wish, {playername}. Just remember that a {reg59?woman:man} needs friends in this world, and you'll never make any if you never stand with anyone.
Sim, minha esposa?
Yes, {reg59?my lady:my lord}?
É bom ver você, velho amigo.

Well, {playername}. I am willing to forgive your impudence in proclaiming yourself {reg59?queen:king} and to welcome you into my realm, with full honor, as one of my vassals. Shall we proceed to the oath of allegiance?
Sim... milorde.
Não. Esse juramento me desagrada.

{playername}, estava esperando por você. Relatos de suas façanhas chegaram aos meus ouvidos. Ao ouvir tais relatos de proezas e bravura eu rapidamente decidi. Eu sabia que havia achado alguém digno de se tornar meu vassalo.
However, you are already oath-bound to serve {s5}, are you not?
I sincerely hope you will become a lord of the realm.
Thank you, {s65}. You honour me with your offer.
É bom ter meu valor reconhecido.
Sim. Vamos dispensar as formalidades, {playername}; você esta pronto para jurar fidelidade a mim?
Não, {s65}. Não posso serví-lo no momento.
Minha senhora, eu andei pensando muito sobre nossas últimas conversas. Acho que é hora de perguntar. Me daria a honra de se tornar minha esposa?
Sim.
Deixe-me pensar sobre isso pouco mais.
Não. Eu decidi que não seria apropriado.
É claro, minha senhora. Leve o tempo que precisar.
Você pretende rejeitar minha pretensão completamente, minha senhora?
Sim.
Não, você não entendeu. Eu só preciso de tempo para pensar.

Bem, nesse caso, deixe-me falar algo -- com essas palavras ríspidas, você removeu as escamas de meus olhos. E agora eles veem que não seria apropriado para mim casar com alguém como você. Passe bem, minha senhora.
Está em seu direito, minha senhora. Se em algum momento reconsiderar isso, ficarei muito feliz.
Minha senhora, meu coração transborda de alegria ao vê-la novamente...
Minha senhora, serei sempre seu humilde servo.
Se não é meu campeão, {playername}...
Good to see you again, {playername}...
Encontramo-nos novamente, {playername}...
Eu conheço você?
Eu sou {playername}.
My name is {playername}. I am at your service, sir.

Good job, {playername}! Looks like you were able to track down the bandits and show them what happens to those who would destroy someone else's property. Here is your reward: {reg5} peningas. It is well earned, and I am very grateful.
Well, {playername}, I guess that at least some of those brigands eluded you, and of course it will be the peaceable citizens of this land who will pay the price. Still, it was good of you to try.
Eu sou {playername}, {s65}.
They know me as {playername}. Mark it down. You shall be hearing of me a lot.

Splendid work, {playername}! Your audacious attack is the talk of the realm. No doubt, they or others like them will soon be back, but for a short while, you have bought this land a small respite. We are most grateful to you.
Well, {playername}, I guess that at least some of those brigands eluded you. Of course, it will be the peaceable travellers of this land who will pay the price. Still, it was good of you to try.

Your surgeon managed to convince my friend to accept the operation.  The matter is in God's hands now. All we can do is pray for his recovery. Anyway, I thank you for lending your surgeon to me, {reg59?madam:sir}. You have a noble spirit. I will not forget it.
Que os céus testemunhem que eu estou pronto para entregar a você minha {s11} {s4}, em casamento...
É bom ver você, {playername}. Estamos ansiosos para o casamento, assim que reunirmos todos para um banquete.{12}
Sem problemas. Posso esperar.
Then we should have a feast right now!
As you wish, your highness.
Unfortunately, we have no acceptable venue for the event.
Não acredito que esse casamento será feito. Por favor devolva meu dote.
Bem, é seu direito, se você realmente não tem confiança nos compromissos de nossa família. Leve seu dinheiro.
I noticed that some of your warriors painted their bodies.
How? That's not important.
What? -- His eyes widen. -- As you know, they are ritual paintings, {playername}.
I'd like to know why they painted their bodies and how I can get the same.
Thanks.

Among my people there are Goidels and Picts. They retain very few of their ancient traditions. We are Christians, but -- he whispers -- many customs of our ancestors still exist among our people. Young warriors are expected to paint their bodies and join the fray of battle and war before they are accepted in their homes as full-grown men. Women have the right to choose wives for their brothers, and children inherit through their mothers' lineage.^^Painting our bodies and joining warrior brotherhoods is part of a tradition in which young people must pass some tests in order to reach maturity. Some tests still involve venturing into distant lands in search of cattle and treasures, then to come home with enough wealth to start a family.

When the young people return, the war paint is removed from their bodies, and they marry and integrate into regular society. There are not a few Pictish women who decide to paint their bodies to participate in this test of initiation.^^-- He smiles. -- It's up to you whether to paint your body or not. If you do, you devote yourself to a very old tradition and to powers that are beyond our understanding. Form or join a group of young people. Make a name for yourselves. Learn the camaraderie, friendship, and pride of being a Pict. Learn to command and obey. Gain the respect of your peers. Meet several {reg59?men:women}... When you've proven your worth, remove the war paint and return to society.
I want to paint my body.
Stop. Your story is prattle. You are a bunch of idiots.
Thanks for the information.

Well, it's not ancient times any more. There are no longer strict rules or rituals. To tell you the truth, I actually feel that I am more Gael than Pict. Remove your garments and let my servant trace the lines on your body. Good luck, young {reg59?lady:man}, with your rite of passage!
Thank you, Toiseach.
I heard that you know Pictland.
I am sorry, but I hardly know you. I do not feel comfortable sharing my knowledge right now. God the mid sie.

What? --His eyes widen.-- Yes, but... do you plan to travel north into Alban? You should not go, {playername}. I was there when I was young and had a fine band of warriors by my side, my beadupreat. Would you care to hear my story?
Sure. I am interested.
No thanks. I have other matters to attend to.

Picts are strange, weird people. --He whispers.-- Some young warriors paint their bodies and become dangerous bandits. Pictish villages are dirty and hidden between the high peaks and dense forests that cover their land. I remember that from several years ago, when I took a war band of young warriors there to plunder and pillage.

After days of travel, we spotted a village spread about a strange construction. Today, I know it was a Broch, a fortress erected by the ancients. The Picts found the ruins, repaired them, and built their homes under its protection. We felt a sudden surge of happiness. There was booty, cattle and women. -- He smiles. -- The doors and gates were wide open. They were not expecting us, we all thought. We started howling like wolves, excited by the prospect of battle. We prepared our spears and swords, gathered our shields and ran, certain that our victory was going to be as easy as it would be profitable. We were young, passionate, and anxious to show our worth. What would you have done?
Mm... Too easy. You should have suspected a trap, but please continue,
What a sorry tale! You behaved like a bunch of untrained recruits.

Yes, I know you are right, but back then we all were exceedingly impetuous. --He beats his chest.-- As for them, well, they were expecting us long before we even knew their village existed. They had archers, by Woden! ...beg pardon, by God! and an awful lot of arrows. Their Isenscur, or rain of arrows, was death to my men. One for one, arrow by arrow. Only I survived, for in fact they knew who I was... I was captured and forced to do their queen's bidding. When she tired of me, they ransomed me for a treasure worth many gold coins. My father gladly paid it when they sent him my left ear inside a finely wrought leather pouch. Hear me! Forget Pictland!
Thank you, my lord. I have learnt much from your story, and I will not meddle in Pictish affairs.
What a sorry tale! Your men behaved like untrained recruits -- with you as an idiot-in-chief.
Now you die!
Now you die!
Mother? Are you fine?
(Remove the sack)
(Carefully, you take the sack off the head of your mother)

{s2}^^Perhaps you thought we were just going to give you your mother? After what you've done -- destroying our plans in Doccinga, insulting my jarl at his own home -- Sigurd Ragnarsson wants you dead.
Welcome, {playername}. My lord, Mael Bresail, told me that you would come.
Where is your lord?
I am ready for the symbel. I only await Mael Bresail.
Adeus.

He is on his way. Some issues in Aileach detained him, but I think that he will come soon. Meanwhile, we have orders to throw a feast for you and your main men. My lord must esteem you greatly, because he has ordered only the best.
Honored guest, I'm sorry, but my lord told me to prepare for five-and-twenty persons. Do you not have more that you would like to participate? Empty places would leave a bad impression...
Honored guest, I'm sorry, but my lord told me to prepare for only five-and-twenty persons. Please come to the feast when you have chosen the ones you would like to participate.
Everything is ready. Please bring your companions to the hall, where you will enjoy the best food and drink.
Muito bem.
Greetings, my {reg59?lady:lord}. What do you need?
I am ready to be konungr over the Norse.
I am ready to be Vrenhin Lloegr, ruler of the Britons.
I am ready to be Ard Ruire, high king of the Goidels.
I am ready to be Brytenwalda, ruler of all Englaland.

You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Norse value their freedom of action. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Konungr of the Norse. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Norse.

You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Britons are tough people. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Vrenhin Lloegr, ruler of the Britons. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Britons.

You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Goidels are independent people who accept with difficulty the leadership of others. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Ard Ruire of the Goidels. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Goidels.

You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Angles and Saxons are distrustful people. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Brytenwalda, ruler over all Englaland. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Angles and Saxons.
Thank you so much for the award and for helping my fame and prestige grow. Farewell, chronicler!
Quem é você?
What about you, Briton?
Goidelic and chronicler? Is this a joke?
What do you do?
Adeus.
I guess that's not an easy question to answer. My role here is to leave for posterity the history of great men. I write the life of the greatest king in this area. I am his chronicler.
I want you to write my story.
Very well. Farewell.

First, you have to be the most important person in this part of the world. That means displacing the person that currently holds that position and unifying under your rule this territory. Do you want to take on this challenge?
Sure.
No. Farewell.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting jarls of the Norse under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Konungr of the Norse, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Ribe, Tunsberg and Dorestad.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} among the Norse.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting lords of the Britons under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Vrenhin Lloegr, the king of the Britons, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Ynys Mon, Bosvenegh and Caer Dyf.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} among the Britons.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting lords of the Goidels under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Ard Ruire, the high king of Eriu, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Aileach, Cruaghan and Temair.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} of Eriu.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting lords of the Angles and Saxons under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Brytenwalda, ruler over all Englaland, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Lundenwic, Witan Ceaster and Jorvik.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} of Englaland.
Very well. I must buy ink and parchment, I will return soon.
{playername}, when you escaped my trap, I came to hide here. From the fact that you have managed to find me, I perceive that, contrary to appearances, you are someone with resources.
Welcome, {playername}. The abbot of Finian informed me that you eliminated the main enemies of my lord and mine. I expect that you've found our rewards a more than acceptable way to get rich.
Pois não?
I am {playername}. I was told you want to meet me.
[Say nothing]

Ah, {playername}! The abbot spoke wonders about you and your diligence in solving my problems. I wanted to meet you personally in order to put a face to my hero.^^--He smiles widely--^^Also, I look forward to hearing news about the matter we have pending.
It is likewise a pleasure to meet you, my lord. Your enemies are at a farm near Dinas Bran.
Flaithbertach's grandchildren are at a farm near Dinas Bran, my lord.
Flaithbertach's grandchildren are at a farm near Dinas Bran.
