Muito bem, como quiser... Meu esposo fez certos inimigos em sua vida, {playername}. Um dos mais audazes é {s13}. Ele sai por ai fazendo terríveis acusações sobre mim, impugnando minha honra a torto e a direito! Uma vez que ele não pode ferir meu marido diretamente, ele está me usando como alvo para tentar manchar nosso nome. Você deveria ouvir as terríveis coisas que ele diz! Eu gostaria que houvesse alguém bravo o suficiente para calá-lo, mas {s13} é um reconhecido e temido espadachim...
Não o temo, {s65}. Farei ele engolir suas mentiras.
Oh! Não posso pedir isso de você, {playername}, mas... seria eternamente grata a você. Será tão bom se você defender minha honra. Muito, muito obrigado. Todas as minhas preces vão com você.
If he is that dangerous, perhaps maybe it would be better to ignore him...
Oh... Perhaps you're right, {playername}. I should let go of these silly childhood ideas of chivalry and courage. {reg59?People:Men} are not like that, not anymore. Good day to you.
Well, {playername}, there is a delicate matter that I am not sure how to solve. I have been having nightmares lately...
You can count on me, my lady. Your secret is safe with me.
Nightmares? Hmm. Well, good luck with that.

Well, {playername}, when I was younger, many years ago, there was a very handsome young guard in our castle. I had never seen anyone so handsome. Long story short, we fell in love, and..., well, we became lovers. But then I was married off to my husband, and my love was sent away. I have never seen him again. I have always suspected that either my father or my husband or both of them learned about our affair and sent him to die somewhere, or just hired an assassin to kill him. It was many years ago, but suddenly I started having these dreams in which he is calling me, asking me to go with him and saying that my husband is the one who murdered him. But many years have passed, and I don't feel the infatuation anymore. He's dead, and I'm not, so how can I join him, anyway? Is he a ghost now, asking me to die to join him?
No need to worry, my lady. I will deal with this 'ghost.' Where exactly is he calling you?
Sorry, I can't help you with that.

He seems to be somewhere around {s33}. Oh, {playername}, I am so grateful. But, please, I beg you, be very discrete about this matter. I don't want my husband or anyone else to know about what happened.
Não, {playername}, eu não tenho necessidade de um campeão no momento.
As you wish, {s65}, it shall be done.
{s66}, temo que não possa ajudá-la no momento.
You are a true {reg59?lady:gentleman}, {playername}. Thank you so much for helping me
You'll not help a woman in need? You should be ashamed, {playername}... Please leave me. I have some important embroidery to catch up on.
Eu gostaria de melhorar minhas relações com um lorde. Poderia me ajudar?
{playername}, não o conheço suficiente para fazer algo por você. Me desculpe.
Hmm. I guess you got on the wrong side of somebody. Very well, with whom do you want to restore your relation?
Esqueça. Eu me dou bem o bastante com todo mundo.
Bem posso tentar ajudá-l{o/a} nisso. Tenho certeza que alguns presentes caros farão {s10} olhar para você mais favoravelmente.

You can improve your relation with {s10} by sending {reg4?her:him} a gift worth {reg10} peningas. But if you can afford spending {reg11} peningas on the gift, it would make a good impression on {reg4?her:him}. And if you can go up to {reg12} peningas, that would really help smooth things out.
I think a gift of {reg10} peningas will do.
Maybe I can afford {reg11} peningas.
In that case, I am ready to spend {reg12} peningas.
Não acho que eu possa conceder um presente no atual momento.
Excelente. Então escolherei um presente apropriado para que você envie para {s10} com seus cumprimentos. Tenho certeza que {reg4?ela:ele} apreciará o gesto.
Obrigado por sua ajuda, madame.
I am afraid that I cannot be of much help in that case, {playername}. I am sorry.
Preciso partir agora.
Ainda não vejo o por que devo aceitar o que está me pedindo.
Then I'll make it worth your while. ({reg8} peningas)
Por favor, faça isso pela nossa amizade. (-{reg9} de relação)
Let me try to convince you. (Persuasion)
Deixa para lá.
Mmm, a generous gift to my coffers would certainly help matters... {reg8} peningas should do it. If you agree, then I'll go with your suggestion.
Temo que minhas finanças não suportem tal presente.
Very well, please accept these {reg8} peningas as a token of my gratitude.
Deixe-me pensar sobre isso pouco mais.
Ah. Nesse caso, há pouco que posso fazer, a menos que você tenha mais algo a dizer.
{Meu caro/Minha cara} {playername}, seu generoso presente me levou a reconsiderar o que me pediu, e tenho que apreciar a sabedoria de sua proposta.
You've done well by me in the past, {playername}, and for that, I will go along with your request, but know that I do not like you using our relationship this way.
Perdoe-me, meu amigo, mas preciso de sua ajuda nisso.
Se isso não te agradar, então tentarei algo diferente.
All right then, {playername}. I will accept this for your sake. But remember, you owe me for this.
Não acho que eu deva tal favor, {playername}. Não vejo razão de aceitar isso.
Isso é uma piada? Você tem coragem em me pedir favores, {playername}. Pois lhe asseguro que não terá nada de mim.
Muito bem. Convença-me.
[Tentar persuadir]
Wait. Perhaps there is another way to convince you.
Goodness sake, {playername}! Haven't we talked enough already? I am tired of listening to you, and I do not want to hear any more of it right now.
All right! All right! You have persuaded me to do it. I'll go ahead with what you suggest.
You have a point, {playername}. I admit that much. However, I am not yet convinced I should do as you bid.
Enough, {playername}. You've made a lot of arguments, but I find none of them truly convincing. I stand by what I said before.
Para falar a verdade, {playername}, não consigo ver o que há de bom no que me disse. O que me pede faz menos sentido agora do que quando pediu antes.
I must congratulate you on your victory, my {reg59?lady:lord}. Welcome to {s1}. We, the housekeepers of this castle, are at your service.
Você é o senescal?

Indeed I am, my {reg59?lady:lord}. I have always served the masters of {s1} to the best of my ability, whichever side they might be on. Thus you may count on my utmost loyalty for as long as you are the {reg59?lady:lord} of this place. Now, do you intend to keep me on as the seneschal? I promise you will not be disappointed.
Muito bem, você pode manter seu posto por enquanto.
Você pode ficar, mas eu ficarei de olho em você.
Thank you, my {reg59?lady:lord}. If you do not mind my impudence, may I inquire as to what you wish to do with the castle?
Eu irei vendê-lo para outro lorde.
Eu pretendo ficar com ele.
Eu ainda não pensei muito nisso. Qual são minhas opções.

De acordo com nossas leis e tradições, você pode fazer uma das seguintes coisas. Primeiro, você poderia colocar uma guarnição aqui para proteger o castelo de contra-ataques imediatos, então procurar uma audiência com algum lorde rico e pedir que ele faça uma oferta. O castelo pode valer uma quantia considerável, pode acreditar. Se não deseja vendê-lo, então deve encontrar um lorde soberano e protetor que aceitaria você como vassalo. Sem apoio e um exército real, será difícil manter o castelo. Você e {s1} serão um potencial alvo para qualquer um com ambição e alguns soldados.
What do you mean, a liege lord and protector? I won this place by my own hand. I don't need anyone else!

Of course you don't, my {reg59?lady:lord}. However, no lord in the land will recognize your claim to the castle unless it is verified by royal decree. They would call {s1} an outlaw stronghold and take it from you at the earliest opportunity. Surely, not even you could stand against a whole army.
Hmm. Vou pensar sobre isso.

I am very pleased to hear it, my {reg59?lady:lord}. I am only trying to serve you to the best of my ability. Now, if at any time you find you have further need of me, I will be in the great hall arranging a smooth handover of the castle to your forces.
Good day, {reg59?madam:sir}. I do not believe I've seen you here before. Let me extend my welcome to you as the seneschal of {s1}.
Um prazer conhecê-lo, {s65}.
Como posso ajudá-lo?
O que exatamente você faz aqui?

Ah, a seneschal's duties are many, good {reg59?woman:sire}. For example, I collect the rents from my lord's estates, I manage the castle's storerooms, I deal with the local peasantry, I take care of castle staff, I arrange supplies for the garrison... All mundane matters on this fief are my responsibility, on behalf of my lord. Everything except commanding the soldiers themselves.
Good day, {reg59?madam:sir}.
Mais alguma coisa?
Eu gostaria de te perguntar uma coisa.
Eu quero saber mais sobre alguém...
Talvez eu possa ajudá-l{o/a}. Quem tem em mente?
Deixa para lá.
Estou de saída. Adeus.
Farei o que puder para ajudar, é claro. O que deseja perguntar?
Talvez você saiba onde encontrar alguém...
Bem, um homem na minha posição realmente ouve todo tipo de coisa. Quem você teria em mente?
Deixa para lá.
There! I can see the walls of {s3} in the distance. We've made it safely. Here, take this purse of {reg3} peningas, as I promised. I hope we can travel together again someday.
Chegamos tão longe... Está o caminho livre a frente?
Pode haver bandidos por perto. Fique conosco.
Trust me, {playername}. We're already staying as close to you as we can. Lead the way.
Nenhum sinal de problema, podemos respirar aliviados.
Eu respirarei aliviado quando chegar a {s1} e em nenhum momento antes. Vamos continuar.
O que você quer? Pagamos sua taxa não faz nem três dias.
Saudações, amigo.
What do you want? We are but simple merchants. We have no quarrel with you, so leave us alone.
Esteja avisado, patife! Esta caravana esta sob proteção de {s9}. Saia do nosso caminho ou enfrente a fúria dele!
Sim? O que quer?
Mais alguma coisa?
Você esta invadindo o território de {s17}. Estou confiscando essa caravana e todos os bens!
O que? Que baboseira é essa? Estamos em paz com {s17}, e somos livres para atravessar essas terras!
Veremos isso! Defendam-se!
Hmm. Foi um mal entendido. Adeus.
Eu tenho uma oferta para você.
O que foi?
Posso escoltá-lo até seu destino por um preço.
Nada. Esqueça.
Estou caçando um grupo de bandidos com a seguinte descrição... Já os viste?
Tell me about your journey.
Estamos vindo de {s11} em direção a {s12}.{s14}
Eu exijo algo de você!
O que você quer?
Há uma taxa para poder passar por aqui!
Please, I don't want any trouble. I can give you {reg6} peningas. Just let us go.
I don't want any trouble. I can give you {reg6} peningas if you'll let us go.
Agreed. Hand it over and you may go in peace.
Very well then. Here's {reg6} peningas.
I changed my mind. I can't take your money.
Não, eu quero tudo que você tem! [Atacar]
Entregue seu ouro e bens valiosos agora!
Nada. Esqueça.
Está nos roubando?{s11}
Roubando você? Não, não! Foi uma piada.
God, don't joke about that, {reg59?lass:lad}. For a moment, I thought we were in real trouble.
É claro que estou roubando você. Agora me entregue suas coisas.
Madit{o/a} seja, não vai ter nada de nós sem lutar!
Essas estradas são perigosas mesmo. Proteção nunca é demais.
Uma escolta? Estamos quase lá! Mesmo assim, obrigado pela oferta.
We are heading to {s1}. I will pay you {reg2} peningas if you escort us there.
Aceito.
Eu quero que fique perto de nós durante o caminho. Precisaremos de sua ajuda caso haja alguma emboscada de bandidos.
Don't worry. You can trust me.
Bom. Fale comigo novamente quando estivermos perto de {s1} para pegar seu dinheiro. Por enquanto, vamos prosseguir.
Esqueça.
Talvez uma outra hora, então.
Não tão rápido. Primeiro, entregue seus bens e seu dinheiro.
Nunca. É nosso dever proteger esses bens. Terá que lutar conosco, salteador!
[Sair]
Good day, my {reg59?lady:lord}. Will you be visiting the prison?
Sim. Destranque a porta.
Sim. Destranque a porta.
Não, não agora.
My {reg59?lady:lord}, just so you know, one of your prisoners is not yet conscious. Do you still desire to enter?
My {reg59?lady:lord}, just so you know, some of your prisoners are not yet conscious. Do you still desire to enter?
Yes, I do.
Não, não agora.
Sim? O que quer?
Yes, your majesty?
Quem está aprisionado aqui?
Quero falar com um prisioneiro.
I order you to release the prisoners.
You're the king, your order is my command, but our lord may take offence to that. Who do you wish to release?
Deixa para lá.
Como você deseja.
No momento, {s50} {reg1?estão aprisionados:está aprisionado} aqui.{s49}
Of course, {reg59?madam:sir}. Go in.
Você precisa ter a permissão do lorde para falar com prisioneiros.
There is nobody inside. Therefore, you can freely go inside and look around.
All right, then I'll take a look at the prison.
Tenho negócios mais importantes em outro lugar.
All right, then I'll try that.
Ora vamos. Achei que você fosse o chefe desse lugar.
Heh-heh. You got that right. Still, I can't let you into the prison.
All right, then I'll leave now.
I found a purse with 100 peningas a few paces away. I reckon it belongs to you.

Ah! I was looking for this all day. How good of you to bring it back, {reg59?madam:sir}. Well, now that I know what an honest {reg59?lady:man} you are, there can be no harm in letting you inside for a look. Go in... Just so you know, though -- I'll be hanging onto the keys, in case you were thinking about undoing anyone's chains.
Me dê as chaves para as celas -- agora!
Socorro! Acuda! Fuga na prisão!
Deixa para lá.
Your orders, {reg59?Lady:Lord}?
Abra a porta. Eu vou entrar.
Deixa para lá.
Suma da minha vista, mendigo! Você fede!
Get lost before I lose my temper, you vile beggar!
Eu quero entrar no salão e falar com o lorde.
[Sair]
Are you out of your mind, {reg59?woman:man}? Beggars are not allowed into the hall. Now get lost or I'll beat you bloody.
O que você quer?
Eu quero entrar no salão e falar com o lorde.
Deixa para lá.
Temo que haja uma festa lá dentro, e você não foi convidad{o/a}.
Você pode entrar depois de deixar suas armas comigo. Ninguém tem permissão de carregar armas no salão de nosso lorde.
Tome minhas armas, vou entrar.
Não, não dou minhas armas a qualquer um.
Então não pode entrar.
O que você quer?
Pois não?
Precisamos de abrigo para essa noite. Pode nos deixar entrar?
Quero falar com o lorde do castelo.
Quero falar com alguém do castelo.
[Sair]
Espere aqui. {s2} irá vê-l{o/a}.
O meu lorde não está aqui agora.
Quem é?
Deixa para lá.
Espere aqui. Vou mandar seu pedido a ele.
Estou esperando...
{reg59?Madam:Sir}, {s2} will talk to you now.
{s2} diz que não verá você. Parta agora.
My lord {s2} will be happy to see you {reg59?madam:sir}. Come on in. I am opening the gates for you.
Meu lorde {s2} não está no castelo nesse momento. Mas acho que ele aprovaria seu pedido de abrigo. Entre, irei abrir os portões para você.
Entre. Estou abrindo os portões para você.
Entre. Mas certifique-se que você e seus homens se comportem dentro desses muros. Meu senhor {s2} não quer confusões aqui.
Meu senhor {s2} não o quer aqui. Parta agora.
Chegou bem na hora. Vamos unir nossas forças e ensinar uma lição ao nosso inimigo.
Está cometendo um grande erro ao lutar contra nós.
Acho que não conheço você como deveria. Você salvou minha vida, e ainda não sei seu nome...
Sua ajuda foi muito bem vinda, estranh{o/a}. Meu nome é {s1}. Posso saber o seu?
Obrigado por sua ajuda, estranh{o/a}. Nós ainda não nos conhecemos, não é verdade? Qual o seu nome?
Meu nome é {playername}.
Well met indeed, {playername}. My name is {s1}, and I am forever in your debt. If there is ever anything I can help you with, just let me know...
Well met, {playername}. I am in your debt for what you just did. I hope one day I will find a way to repay it.
Well met, {playername}. I am {s1}. Thanks for your help and I hope we meet again.
Novamente salvando nossos pescoços, {playername}! Você é o melhor dos amigos, é sério. {s43}
You arrived just in the nick of time, {playername}! You have my deepest thanks! {s43}
Você apareceu bem em tempo, {playername}. Não esquecerei sua ajuda. {s43}
Bom ver você aqui {playername}. {s43}
Thank you for your help, {reg59?madam:sir}. You saved {reg1?our lives:my life} out there.
Thank you for your help {reg59?madam:sir}. Things didn't look very well for us but then you came up and everything changed.
Thank you for your help, {reg59?madam:sir}. It was fortunate to have you nearby.
Oh, {reg59?madam:sir}, thank you so much for rescuing me. Will you take me to my family now?
Estou em dívidas com você por me libertar, amigo.
Você não vai a lugar algum, 'amigo'. Você é meu prisioneiro agora.
Ora bolas. Minha sorte parece nunca mudar...
Está livre para partir, {s65}.
Thank you, good {reg59?lady:sire}. I never forget someone who's done me a good turn.
Gostaria de se unir a minha companhia?
All right, I will join you.
Não, vou seguir meu caminho.
Não viverá o suficiente para celebrar esta vitória. Meus seguidores irão logo limpar a mancha que foi esta derrota.
Você é meu prisioneiro agora.
Maldit{o/a} seja. Irá se arrepender por isso.
Está livre para partir desta vez, mas não cruze meu caminho novamente.
Nos veremos novamente.
Eu acho que é uma ação sábia. Boa sorte para você.

Your relations with {s4} are not all that they could be. As {reg4?she:he} is my {s11}, I can mediate to attempt to mend your quarrel. Perhaps the best way for me to do this would be to send {reg4?her:him} a gift, perhaps, if I may suggest, some bracelets and brooches, and a length of silver fox fur. If you can provide me with these items, I can have them sent to {reg4?her:him} on your behalf.
Esplêndido. Eu aguardarei pelos materiais.

As you may realize, {s4} has many enemies among the lords of the {s5}. In particular, they feel that {reg4?she:he} is {s7}, and worry that {reg4?she:he} will {s8}. Were you to denounce {s4} to {reg4?her:his} face, you may reap much popularity -- although, of course, you would make an enemy of {reg4?her:him} and risk being challenged to a duel.

As you may realize, many of us in the peerage of the {s5} consider {s4} to be {s7}, and a liability to our cause. We worry that {reg4?she:he} will {s8}. People know my views on {s4} already, but if you were to denounce {reg4?her:him} to {reg4?her:his} face, you would further erode his standing -- and discourage our liege from entrusting {reg4?her:him} with any more power or responsibility. Of course, you would make an enemy of {reg4?her:him} and risk being challenged to a duel.{s9}
Nós apreciamos o que está fazendo. Eu não gosto dessas intrigas, mas é tudo para o bem de {s5}.
Muito bem. É sempre arriscado se envolver em intrigas desse tipo, mas nesse caso, eu acho que você irá se beneficiar.

Você e eu temos um interesse comum em procurar diminuir a ascensão de {s4}. Eu sinto que {reg4?ela:ele} é {s7}, e me preocupo que {reg4?ela:ele} irá {s8}. Caso você diga a nosso suserano {s9} sua opinião sobre {s4}, poderá desencorajar {s9} a conceder poderes e responsabilidades a {s4}, pelo menos por enquanto, e ele ficará muito grato a você.
Nós apreciamos o que está fazendo. Eu não gosto dessas intrigas, mas é tudo para o bem de {s5}.
Não consigo pensar em nada no momento, mas nós teremos itens de mútuo interesse no futuro.
Eu gosto dessa ideia.
Hmm... Maybe you can think of something else.
Vamos discutir outro tópico
Muito bem.
Muito bem.
Muito bem.
Muito bem.
Piedade! Por favor não me mate!
Não tenho nada contra você rapaz. Mas {s2} quer você morto. Sinto muito.
Maldito seja! Que você queime no Inferno!
Eu permitirei que você viva, se me prometer...
É claro, eu prometo, farei qualquer coisa. Apenas poupe minha vida...
Você terá que esquecer o débito que {s2} tem com você. E vai assinar um papel onde diz que ele não lhe deve nada.
Sim, é claro. Farei como pedir.
E se meu senhor ouvir qualquer coisa ou crítica sobre essa situação, então eu voltarei a vê-lo, e não adiantará clamar por piedade dessa vez. Você me entendeu?
Yes {reg59?madam:sir}. Don't worry. I won't make any complaint.
Bom. Vá rápido antes que eu mude de ideia.
O que você quer?
Eu procuro por um assassino com o nome de {s4}. Você bate com a descrição dele.
Nada. Desculpe incomodá-lo.
I don't understand, {reg59?madam:sir}. I never killed anyone. I think you've got the wrong man.
Então largue sua espada. Se você é inocente, não tem nada a temer. Iremos falar com seus vizinhos e eles verificarão sua história, vou indo.
Não irei a lugar algum. Você terá que lutar por sua prata hoje.
Sem problema. Eu só preciso da sua cabeça mesmo.
Eu não vim por dinheiro, mas sim para executar a lei!
Infelizmente, não consigo convencê-lo.
Morra, cão!
O que você quer?
I am looking for a {s13} stolen from {s9} of {s3}. You look like the fellow I am looking for.
Nada. Desculpe incomodá-lo.
I don't understand, {reg59?madam:sir}. I never stole anything. I think you've got the wrong man.
Then come with me. If you are innocent, you have nothing to fear. We'll go now and talk to {s9} of {s3}, and if he says you are not the man who stole his {s13}, you'll be free to go.
I'm not going anywhere, friend. You're going to have to fight for your silver today.
No problem. Too bad you can't see reason.
Die, scum!
Who the hell are you? What do you want?
I told you everything I know. Now leave me alone!
My name is {playername}. Sound familiar? I have some questions for you.
My name is {playername}. Sound familiar? I came to fetch your head.
Well, you asked for it, {playername}!
Questions? I am not going to answer any questions, and I have no idea who you are!
This is the last warning: answer me or die!
I've had enough of you! Prepare to die!
Now I recognize you, {playername}. I'll answer your questions if you spare my life.
I still don't know who you are and what you are talking about. I'll try to answer your questions, but stop threatening me.

I was attacked by some thugs not so long ago. I managed to dispose of the attackers and found a note saying to meet a contact in {s3}. Both you and I know you are that contact. I really don't care about you, but rather need to know who ordered this and why.
Alright, if you promise to let me go... 'Twas {s9} of {s10}. Don't ask me why; I don't know.
I am sorry to hear about your mishaps, but I have nothing to tell you. Be gone now.
Thanks! You've both helped me and saved yourself. Be gone now.
Then prepare to die!
Sorry to bother you, sir.
Excuse me, {playername}? Don't tell me you believe everything people say on the street. People who want to bring me down or destroy our friendship spread those rumors.
True, most rumors are nothing more than lies. Not, in this case though. I have met someone who told me all about your involvement in this matter. Would you like to meet him too?

Hmm, you see, {playername}, it wasn't really my choice. Some lords are not very happy with your rise in power, so they all ordered me to organize this err... accident. What could I do? I didn't want to do this, but what choice did I have?
So what, {playername}? No one likes you. You are nothing more than a stupid upstart among us real nobles! Too bad those idiots couldn't finish the job!

Well, {playername}, welcome to real world. If you rise fast, be prepared to pay the price. Some lords are unhappy with you, and I guarantee this is not the last time something like that happens, so be prepared. Don't say I didn't warn you.
Whatever the reason, I demand satisfaction.
Then it's my duty to inform your liege of your criminal deeds.
I apologize. I acted rashly.
Sorry, I don't have that kind of money
Fine, {playername}. I will give you the money, although you come across as a blackmailer.
Sorry, {playername}, you sound like a dirty blackmailer, and I don't pay them no matter what.
{playername}, you are nothing but a dirty blackmailer, and I have no choice but to defend my honor.
Well, I think that {reg22} peningas is a bit too much. How about {reg23}?
Just like I thought of you, {playername}: full of greed. Here, take your dirty money!
I will never pay such a low life like you, {playername}! I have no choice but to fight such scum, but heaven knows someone has to do the dirty job!
I will never pay such a low life like you, {playername}! I have no choice but to fight such scum, but heaven knows someone has to do the dirty job!
Ha-ha-ha, what is this? Extortion? Prepare to fight!
Ha-ha-ha, what is this? Extortion? Prepare to fight!
I don't like it, but I guess I have to pay you off.
Ha-ha-ha, what is this? Extortion? Prepare to fight!
Ha-ha-ha, what is this? Extortion? Prepare to fight!
I don't like it, but I guess I have to pay you off. Watch your back, though!
Nice doing business with you.
I forgive you
Marvellous. Let's go.
When it comes to honor, bargaining is inappropriate. {reg22} peningas it is.
Then {reg23} peningas will do.
Here is the money. I will take care of that village idiot myself.
Argh! Aren't you a little scummy tattle teller! I have to teach you a lesson!
Argh! Aren't you a little scummy tattle teller! I have to teach you a lesson!
Ok, I changed my mind. I will take the money instead.
My honor is not for sale. Your liege needs to know about your dirty deeds.
That's an insult. I demand satisfaction!
You will tell my liege no such thing!
You will tell my liege no such thing!
I will take the money
I forgive you.
This is unacceptable! I demand satisfaction!
Yes {reg59?madam:sir}?
Leve essa carta até {s1} e a de para {s2}.
Nada. Não foi nada.
Yes {reg59?madam:sir}. You can trust me. I will not fail you.
Bom. Não esquecerei seu serviço. Será recompensado quando retornar.
Arggh! Não posso fazer isso. Vou te matar!
What do you mean, {reg59?madam:sir}?
Há uma armadilha armada para você na cidade. {s3} ordenou que eu sacrificasse um de meus guerreiros para enganar o inimigo, mas ele que encontre outra maneira.
Thank you, {reg59?madam:sir}. I will follow you to the gates of hell. But this would not be a good death.
Don't worry, {reg59?madam:sir}, I'm on my way.
Good day, {reg59?madam:sir}. Such fine weather, don't you think? If you'll excuse me now, I must go on my way.
Em nome de {s1}, você está preso!
Não me pegará com vida!
Deixa para lá. Eu estava apenas de passagem.
Saudações.
Em nome de {s1}, você está preso!
Terá que lutar conosco antes!
Deixa para lá. Eu estava apenas de passagem.
Good day, {reg59?madam:sir}.
I have been sent by your {s4}, whom you are running from. He will not punish you if you return now.

My good {reg59?madam:sir}. Our lives at our village {s1} was unbearable. We worked all day long and still went to bed hungry. And now this swine, our lord, forced us to become warriors! We are going to {s6} to start a new life, where we will be treated like humans.
Vocês violaram as nossas leis fugindo de sua ligação. Irão voltar para {s1} agora!
Well, maybe you are right. All right, then, but if anyone asks, I haven't seen you.
All right, {reg59?madam:sir}. As you wish. We'll head back to {s5} now.
God bless you, {reg59?madam:sir}. We will not forget your help.
Good day and many thanks, {reg59?madam:sir}. Don't worry. If anyone asks, we haven't seen you.
Eu mudei de ideia. Você deve voltar a sua vila!
Good. Go quickly now, before I change my mind.
Good day {reg59?madam:sir}. We were heading back to {s5}, but I am afraid we lost our way.
Não teste minha paciência. Você vai voltar agora!
Bem, se está tão ávido para ir, então vá.
We are on our way back to {s5} {reg59?madam:sir}.
Depressa. Quanto antes você retornar melhor.
Bom. Continuem.
Yes {reg59?madam:sir}. As you wish.
Este deve ser seu dia de azar, camarada. Somos o pior tipo de pessoas para se encontrar nessas bandas.
This must be your unlucky day, mate. We're just about the worst people you could run into in these parts.
Heh. For me, you are nothing more than walking moneybags. {s1} offered me good money for your heads.
Heh. For me, you are nothing more than walking moneybags. A merchant in {s1} offered me good money for your heads.
A bounty hunter! I hate bounty hunters! Kill {reg59?her:him}! Kill {reg59?her:him} now!
O que você quer? Quer nos pagar mais dinheiro?
Desculpe incomodá-lo. Seguirei em meu caminho agora.
É. Pare de saracotear por ai e vá fazer dinheiro. Eu quero ver aquela bolsa cheia na próxima vez que eu encontrar você.
Não. É sua vez de me pagar desta vez.
Que bobagem está falando? Quer problemas? Você achou.
Somos os irmãos livres. Lutaremos por conta própria a partir de agora. Agora nos dê seu ouro ou prove do nosso aço.
When I'm done with you, you'll regret ever leaving your lord.
Não há necessidade de lutar. Estou disposto a pagar para passar.
Do you know whom you address? I will not kill you if you join me.
I care very little who you are. It's time for you to die.
Yes, I've heard of you. They say your men collect the best loot. Forgive us, and we will be delighted to join such a fierce leader
We would consider your offer if you fronted us {reg0} peningas.
It is a good bargain, considering your proven head busting skills. Welcome to the band, lads.
Não tenho dinheiro suficiente...
Ouch! You value your worth over much, methinks. Forget it.
Why, you are just the sort of gentle lads I dream of accompanying me!
Never mind. On second thought, we have enough lads to split the wealth with.
Ooh. Well, we'll let you do the valuating then.
Not to worry, dearie. We'll reduce that number for you!
Nós deixaremos você em paz.

Good. You are clever. Now, having a look at your baggage, I reckon a fellow like you could pretty easily afford {reg5} peningas. We wouldn't want to be too greedy, now would we? Pay us, and then you can go.
All right, here's your {reg5} peningas.
Não tenho tanto dinheiro comigo.
Que pena. Então teremos que vender vocês como escravos.
Heh. That wasn't difficult, now, was it? All right, you may go.
Mais alguma coisa?
I was told to deliver to you {reg9} units of {s4}.

At last! My stock was almost depleted. I had paid the cost of the {s4} in advance. Here, take these {reg5} peningas. That should cover your pay. And give {s9} my regards. I'll put in a good word for you next time I deal with him.
I was told to deliver to you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost some of the cargo on the way.

Attacked by bandits, eh? You are lucky they left you alive. Anyway, I can pay no more than {reg5} peningas for this. You can be sure, though, that I will let {s1} know that the delivery was short. They will probably charge you for the loss.
I was told to deliver to you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost the cargo on the way.
What? I have been waiting for that {s4} for weeks, and now you tell me that you lost it? You may rest assured that I will let {s1} know about this.
I want to send a message.
We can do that. Who do you want to sent it to? I've heard the following are nearby:
No, none of those. Later, perhaps.
Very well. What is the message?
It is this...
I'd like to buy every man who comes in here tonight a jar of your best mead.
Of course, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I reckon {reg5} peningas should be enough for that. What should I tell the lads?
Que todos saibam da generosidade de {playername} para com as pessoas de {s10}.
Actually, forget this.
Don't worry {reg59?madam:sir}. Your name will be cheered and toasted here all night.
I'd like to buy me and my men a barrel of your best ale.
Of course, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I reckon {reg5} peningas should be enough for that. What should I tell the lads?
The price is fair enough. Let my men have at it.
Don't worry {reg59?madam:sir}. Your men will enjoy their pints.
Actually, forget this.
Have you heard of anyone in this realm who might have a job for a {reg59?woman:man} like me?
Hmm... Bem, {s10} está sempre a procura de mercenários para lutar em suas guerras.{s9}
Where can I get special weapons and armor?
Hmm... Well, there are talented blacksmiths that can make them. But, if you want to know their names, you must pay me fifty peningas for the information.
Sure. Talk!
You are a rat. Farewell!

Well, several towns can boast of talented blacksmiths: Eadwine of Dunwic,^Donnchadh of Scuin,^Paega of Witan Ceaster,^Lifris of Bosvenegh,^Fearchair of Ceall Cainnigh,^Atli of Tunsberg,^Harenbili of Dun Breatann,^Egil of Dubh Linn,^Godgyfu Cirren Ceaster,^and Uormuin of Caer Dyf.
Thank you. Farewell!
Deixe-me pensar um pouco mais...
Eu ouvi que {s7} {s9}{s10} Você talvez queira falar com {reg4?ela:ele}.

There may be other work, of course -- lords and village mayors often have other tasks which we don't hear about. Also, the villages around here frequently need help, although they'd be more likely to pay you with a wedge of cheese and goodwill than with cold hard peningas.
Eu ficarei com meus ouvidos atentos para outras oportunidades. Pode perguntar a mim novamente de tempos em tempos.
Any news in this part of the world?
I guess it's not exactly news, but the world is becoming increasingly dangerous. The roads are full of bandits.
A storm is coming. It's not thunder and lightning but war.
They say that Hild is now the most beautiful woman in all of Englaland. That's why she never comes here anymore! (wink)
Bards say that King Aelle of Bernaccia ordered Ragnar to be thrown into a pit of vipers. That's why his sons are now attacking Englaland.
When Aethelwulf of West Seaxe died, Aethelbald, his eldest son, married Judith, his widow! Ach, that's what queens are for, eh?
Recently, Aelfred, secundarius of West Seaxe, married Ealhswith, daughter of Aethelred Mucil, ealdorman of the Gaini, and of Lady Eadburh. That puts him in the royal line of the Mercians.
It's no secret that Harald of Norway aims to be king of all Norwegians so he can marry a certain princess. He's vowed not to comb his hair until then.
In the Kingdom of Alban, the king has trouble resolving disputes between Picts and Goidels. They seem to be always at war with each other.
I have not heard anything notable to tell.
Obrigado.
Preciso partir agora.
Greetings to you, {reg59?madam:sir}. You look like someone who should get to know me.
Por que isto?

Eu negocio resgates para aquelas pobres almas que são capturadas nessas guerras intermináveis. Normalmente eu viajo entre as minas de sal e os mercados de escravos na costa, além de negociar com os parentes que perderam alguém. Mas se uma dessas fontes seca eu abordo camaradas que arrastam um ou dois prisioneiros atrás dele. Não há maldade em um investimento especulativo, não é verdade? E você parece o tipo de pessoa que teria prisioneiros para vender.
O que acontece se as familias deles não podem pagar?

Oh, then I spin them a few heartwarming tales of life on the galleys. You'd be surprised what sorts of treasures a peasant can dig out of his cowshed or wheedle out of his cousins, assuming he's got the proper motivation! If, in the end, they cannot come up with the silver, then there are always slave merchants who are looking for galley slaves. One cannot do Heaven's work with an empty purse, you see.
O que posso receber por um prisioneiro?

It varies. I fancy that I have a fine eye for assessing a ransom. There are a dozen little things about a man that will tell you whether he goes to bed hungry, or dines each night on soft dumplings and goose. The real money of course is in the gentry, and if you ever want to do my job you'll want to learn about every landowning family in the Northlands, their estates, their heraldry, their offspring both lawful and bastard, and, of course, their credit with the merchants.
Você seria capaz de me resgatar se eu fosse levado?

Of course. I'm welcome in every court in the Northlands. There are not many who can say that! So always be sure to keep a pot of peningas buried somewhere, and a loyal servant who can find it in a hurry.
É tudo o que eu queria saber. Obrigado.
Saudações. Se tiver alguns prisioneiros, ficaria feliz se pudesse comprá-los de você.
De qualquer modo, se tiver alguns prisioneiros, ficaria feliz se pudesse comprá-los de você.
Then you'd better bring your purse. I have prisoners to sell.
I want to sell all prisoners I have.
Well, come back when you have more slaves for me.
Me diga o que você faz novamente.
Eu gostaria de resgatar um de meus companheiros.
Quem você gostaria de resgatar?
Deixa para lá.

Let me check my ledger, here... Yes. Your friend is being held in the dungeon at {s7}. How interesting! I remember hearing that the rats down there are unusually large -- like mastiffs, they say... Now... For the very reasonable sum of {reg5} peningas, which includes both the ransom and my commission and expenses, we can arrange it so that {s5} can once again enjoy {reg4?her:his} freedom. What do you say?
Aqui está seu dinheiro.
Não posso pagar isso no momento.
Esplêndido! Em alguns dias, acho que verá {s5} cavalgando para se juntar a você novamente, radiante a luz do dia e sem dúvida muito grato! Há algo mais que possa fazer para ajudá-lo?

É claro, é claro... Esqueça o que disse sobre os ratos, a propósito -- Eu nunca os vi pessoalmente, pois lá é muito escuro. De qualquer maneira, tenho certeza que {s5} irá entender porque é importante para você controlar seus gastos. Bom... algo mais?
Not this time. Farewell.
Deixe-me ver o que você tem...
Eu ficarei aqui por alguns dias. Venha a mim se precisar de meus serviços.

Greetings, friend. You look like the kind of {reg59?person:man} who'd do well to know me. I travel a lot all across the Northlands and keep an open ear. I can provide you information that you might find useful. For a meager price of course.
Greetings, {playername}. I saw your companion {s10} at in a mead hall in {s11} some days ago. I thought you might like to know.
Obrigado. Eu irei lá e {reg3?a:o} encontrarei.
Obrigado, mas não me importo.
Saudações, {playername}.
Pois não?
O que você pode me dizer sobre esta terra?

The Northlands is divided into many kingdoms that can neither manage to live in peace with their neighbours nor eliminate them. As a result, there's seldom a break in the bitter wars that plague this land and drain its lifeblood. Well, at least this ought to be a good place to be for an adventurer such as you. With some luck and skill, you can make a name for yourself here, amass a fortune perhaps, or gain great power. Opportunities are endless, and so are the rewards, if you are willing to risk your life for them.
Conte-me mais sobre estas oportunidades.
Obrigado. Isso é tudo que queria saber.
Bem, você provavelmente sabe tudo que eu pretendia contar. Você parece estar se saindo muito bem.

The kingdoms will pay good money for mercenaries if they are engaged in a war. If you have done a bit of fighting, speaking with one of their lords will probably result in being offered a mercenary contract.^^Better rewards come if you can manage to become a vassal to a king. A vassal can own villages, castles and towns and get rich with the taxes and revenues of these estates. Normally, only nobles of the realm own land in this way, but in time of war, a king will not hesitate to accept someone who distinguishes {reg59?herself:himself} on the battlefield as a vassal, and grant {reg59?her:him} the right to own land.

It is not unheard-of for adventurers to renounce allegiance to a king altogether, declare themselves kings, and claim land in their own name. This is a difficult path, however, as the great nobles of the land, with their long ancestries, are not likely to accept such upstarts as their monarch. Such rulers would need to be very careful in establishing their right to rule, or they would be set upon from all sides.

It might be easier for an adventurer like you to pledge support to an existing king's rival. There are many such pretenders in the Northlands -- those who are born to the right family, who go around and stir up trouble saying they have a better claim to the throne than the current king does. If those claim holders could find supporters, they could easily start civil wars and perhaps even replace the king one day.
Interessante. Onde posso encontrar tais pessoas?
Acho que já ouvi o suficiente. Obrigado.

A vida de um usurpador seria perigosa se ele ficasse no mesmo reino que pretende tomar. Portanto, eles ficam usualmente em cortes rivais, procurando apoio e esperando que algum dia um campeão apareça para se unir à causa deles. Eu fico sabendo de notícias sobre eles de vez em quando, e posso dizer a localização deles para você com alguma precisão. Mas é claro, eu vou pedir algo em troca por tal serviço.
Eu quero saber a localização de um usurpador.
A localização de quem que você quer saber?
Deixa para lá.
I can reveal this information to you for a small price. Let's say 30 peningas.
All right, here are thirty peningas.
Deixa para lá.
{s15} está atualmente em {s11}.
Eu estou procurando por um de meus companheiros...
Talvez eu possa ajudá-l{o/a}. Quem você procura?
Deixa para lá.
I guess I know where {s15} is. For 30 peningas, I'll tell you.
All right, here are thirty peningas.
Deixa para lá.
{s15} está atualmente em {s11}.{s12}
I know you travel a lot. Could you spread some rumors while travelling?
Hmm, everything is possible, for the right price, of course. What kind of rumors do you have in mind?
I would like you to spread rumors about a lord's disloyalty.
I would like you to spread rumors about a lord's indiscretion.
I just want to start a quarrel between two lords.
Which lord from {s32} do you have in mind?
Deixa para lá.
Very well. Do you want to spread rumors about {s31}?
Very well. What is the second lord's faction?
Which lord from the {s32} do you have in mind?
Very well. Do you want to start a quarrel between {s31} and {s35}?
Yes, that is exactly what I want you to do.
Very well. I will try to sow some rumors per your wish. Check back in a week to see if the rumors are working.
Sorry, I don't have the money.
Actually, I changed my mind.
Greetings. They say you're the kind of {reg59?woman:man} who'd be interested to hear that I travel frequently to the {s17}. I'll tell you all I know for a mere 100 peningas.
Here's 100 peningas. Tell me what you know.
Sorry, friend. I am not interested.
Well, that's all I can tell you. Farewell.
Adeus.
Good day {reg59?madam:sir}, will you be looking at my books?
Sim. Mostre-me o que você tem para vender.
Of course {reg59?madam:sir}.
Mais alguma coisa?
Nada. Obrigado.
I like your weapons, but I need something more... special.
But of course, {reg59?madam:sir}.
Sorry, friend, but my art is for the men of fame only. Come back when you've made a name for yourself (600 renown).
I sell specialty items. I can make a noble sword or elite spear, or I can sell you an axe from Frankia, and more... The quality depends on the material that I have today. What would you like?
I'd like the sword. I'll call it Widow Maker (13000 peningas).
The spear, please (8000 peningas).
I'd like the Frankish axe. It's a symbol of wealth (11000 peningas).
I'd like something else. Surprise me (4 options, 10000 peningas).
Nothing. Thank you.
Good luck. Remember my name if you need something else. Farewell.
I like your armors, but I need something more... special.
Sure thing, {reg59?madam:sir}.
Sorry, friend, but my art is for the men of fame only. Come back when you've made a name for yourself (600 renown).

I sell specialty items. I can sell you a suit of mail from Frankia. If you need a helmet, I can make you a noble helmet or a hersir helmet, and more... The quality depends on the material that I have today. What would you like?
The mail, please. I'd like to have it (17000 peningas).
I'd like the noble helm. It's a symbol of wealth (9000 peningas).
I'd like the hersir helm. I love how it accentuates my facial features (12000 peningas).
I'd like something else. Surprise me (4 options, 19000 peningas).
Nothing. Thank you.
Good luck. Remember my name if you need something else. Farewell.
Hello, {reg59?my lady:my lord} - she smiles and looks at you provocatively -, How can I serve you?
I am at your service, {playername}.
I need to raise the morale of my men.
I do not want anything for my men. I would like your company.
I'm not interested. Farewell.
Your men will have a big feast, with our girls serving the best mead, our finest food, and bards... It will cost you 1500 peningas.
I suppose my men have earned it. This time.
Alas, my lady, your charms are beyond the reach of my purse.
Nice. You like me, {reg59?my lady:my lord}, don't you? Well, for you, there is a special price of only 100 coins. As a token of our 'friendship'...
Great, here, take these coins as a 'gift.'
No thanks. You are trying to rob me.

(Time passes, and you forget the rigors and fatigue from the journey that had lingered upon your body and soul. For a few hours, your armor and sword, the fear of dying in any skirmish, the punishment of the rain and wind, and the dust of the roads are all shoved under a small patch of happiness. But, in the end, it ends all too soon, when your 'friend' quietly leaves the room.)
Greetings to you, {reg59?most noble lady:most noble sir}.
What is it that you do?
I have some questions about courtship in these lands.
Poderia me ensinar alguns poemas?

I can teach you the tale of Aeneas and Dido, from the Aeneid. It is an allegoric poem that describes how Dido, the Queen of Carthage, fell in love, under the influence of the gods, with the Trojan hero Aeneas. When reminded by Jupiter, he leaves his lover to fulfill his duty to found a new city, Dido commits suicide, cursing Aeneas and calling down revenge in a symbolic anticipation of the fierce wars between Carthage and Rome. Its theme -- of strong love separated by fate and cursed by suicide -- is appreciated by some noble ladies, but not all.

I can teach you The Voyage of Bran. This Goidelic saga can be interpreted either erotically or prophetically. Bran, son o Fedbal, and his expedition of twenty-one companions journey to a distant island of luxury and pleasure. Upon return, he learns that ages have passed, and he and his expedition have already passed into myth. He can never again touch the soil of his homeland and sails off again. I believe that it appeals to women of a certain romantic temperament, but you risk scandalizing or boring others.

I can teach you the tragic tale of Orpheus, son of Morpheus and the muse Calliope. It is a sad and powerful story. He travels to the Underworld to bring back Euridyce, his deceased wife, but is unable to obey the condition imposed by Hades and Persephone. Hear me.

I can teach you the saga of Beowulf. It is a heroic tale, full of blood and battle. Beowulf, a hero of the Geats, battles three powerful antagonists: Grendel, a horrid monster, who has been attacking the resident warriors of the mead hall of Hrodgar, king of the Danish, Grendel's mother, and a terrible dragon. Hear me.

I can teach you the Aesopica, the famous fables of Aesop. The tales of this slave and storyteller usually feature animals, and are both comical, satirizing man and animal, and moral, for its practical lessons on life. Pay you heed.
To teach it to you, I will need some hours of your time -- and, of course, a small fee for my services. About 300 peningas would suffice.
Eu acho que você já conhece os poemas que eu poderia te ensinar.
Sim -- me ensine esse poema
Deixa para lá.

Very well -- repeat after me:^But anxious cares already seized the queen^She fed within her veins a flame unseen^The hero's valor, acts, and birth inspire^Her soul with love, and fan the secret fire...

Very well -- repeat after me:^There is a distant isle,^Around which sea-horses glisten^A fair course against the white-swelling surge,^Four feet uphold it.^A delight of the eyes, a glorious range,^Is the plain on which the hosts hold games^Coracle contends against chariot^In southern Mag Findargat...

Very well -- repeat after me:^The muse Calliope bore to Morpheus a son named Orpheus^Who practised minstrelsy and by his songs moved stones and trees^When his wife Eurydice died, bitten by a snake, he went down to Hades, being fain to bring her up,^He persuaded Hades to send her up with him, back to life^The god promised to do so, if on the way Orpheus would not turn round until he should be come to his own house.^But he disobeyed and turning round beheld his wife; and she turned back to the Underworld, forever lost...

Very well -- repeat after me:^Lo, praise of the prowess of people-kings^Of spear-armed Danes, in days long sped,^We have heard, and what honor the aethelings won!^Oft Scyld the Scefing from squadroned foes,^From many a tribe, the mead-bench tore, awing the earls...

Very well -- repeat after me:^A Lion was awakened from sleep by a Mouse running over his face^Rising up angrily, he caught him and was about to kill him, when the Mouse piteously entreated, saying:^If you would only spare my life, I would be sure to repay your kindness.^The Lion laughed and let him go...
'But anxious cares already seized the queen...'
'There is a distant isle...'
'The muse Calliope bore to Morpheus a son named Orpheus...'
'LO, praise of the prowess of people-kings...'
'A Lion was awakened from sleep by a Mouse running over his face...'
Pff... Que tipo de baboseira é essa?

Very well. If the poem is not to your taste, then keep your money. Only, remember: with poets and with lovers, what is important is not what pleases you but what pleases your audience. If you wish to learn the poem, I am still willing to teach.
Muito bom -- mas ainda há muitas estrofes para aprender. Agora ouça atentamente...
Você poderia me dizer algo sobre as damas disponíveis nesse reino?
Quem você gostaria de saber?
Apenas diga as últimas fofocas
Deixa para lá.
Ela esta casada com você, é claro! Claramente, ninguém sonharia que ela poderia fazer parte de alguma fofoca.
Muito interessante -- mas vamos falar de outra coisa.
Muito interessante -- alguma outra notícias?
What? I'll have that miscreant face my sword.
Do you mean that? {s11} will be honor-bound to fight you, but challenging a lord to duel over a woman is seen as a bit hotheaded, even in this warlike age.
Sim -- eu planejo forçar {s11} a abrir mão de suas pretensões com {s12}
Não -- permiti que minhas paixões me deixassem levar.
As you wish. I will spread the word of your intentions, so that {s13} does not try to back out...
Você sabe de alguma festa em andamento?
Adeus.
O que você quer saber?
Posso ser útil em mais alguma coisa?
Há algum lugar para mim no jogo do amor?
Como um pretendente encontraria uma dama?
Tendo conhecido uma dama, como um pretendente pode cortejá-la?
Tell me about marriage and love among the nobility of the Northlands

Nobles are an odd lot. In the Northlands, a daughter is a political asset, to be given away to a lord with whom her father wishes to make an alliance. Yet the great families of this land idealize pure love between man and woman, and I have seen many a hardened warrior weep copious tears at the doomed ardour of Gwenhwyfar and Llwch Llenlleawg in the bards' songs -- even as he made plans to break his own daughter's heart.

Fathers differ, of course. Some nobles will let their daughters choose a husband who pleases them. Others, however, feel that to allow their daughters any choice at all would be to diminish their own authority, and insist on imposing a groom whether she likes it or not.

But the majority will steer a middle course -- they will want to make the final decision about a groom, but will weigh their daughter's preferences heavily. Among other factors, a happy marriage is more likely to produce heirs, so there is still a place for courtship and for the use of skill and passion to win a lady's heart.
O que acontece se o pai não concorda com o pretendente?
It happens sometimes that a bride elopes. This is a major blow to the father's prestige, leading to lasting enmities. Indeed, a war may be fought over a woman. Now, that is a fine topic for a song.

No fim das contas, a maioria das noivas irão submeter-se à escolha de seus pais. A família é tudo para elas, e poucas são corajosas o suficiente para arriscar uma desaprovação em prol do homem que ela nem conhece direito. Elas podem fraquejar por um amante, mas ainda assim aceitar o noivado -- e sem um caso desses de amor trágico, o que teríamos para cantar?

Of course! Lords make a great deal of lineage, but in the end, lands and money speak louder than one's ancestors. Even though you are a foreigner, if you are coming up in the world, then many parents will consider you a fine catch.

You will have to compete with many other lords of your realm, however, who will have an advantage. They have known these ladies from childhood and have been sized up as grooms by carefully discerning mothers and aunts. Some ladies may be fascinated by the stranger, yet opt for the familiar.

Saiba isso -- poderá ter seu coração partido. Mas entrando na arena do amor temendo ter o coração partido é como entrar no campo de batalha temendo as flechas inimigas. Seja bravo, e ignore o ferrão da rejeição, assim a vitória será sua.

Lady -- I will speak bluntly. Most of the lords of this land are looking for a demure maiden, whose skin as fair as snow -- and your skin is burnt brown by the sun. They want a maiden whose voice is soft as bells -- and your voice is hoarse from commanding men in battle. Also, although the lords of the Northlands appreciate poems about love, most also want heirs, and few women can ride and fight while with child.

Contudo, nem todos os lordes são assim tão convencionais. Nós poetas temos contos de donzelas armadas e caçadoras, mulheres que conquistarão suas vidas sacrificando a chance de amar. Eu diria a você que não será fácil achar uma marido devoto que aceitará o seu modo de ser, mas não é impossível.
What advantage is there in seeking a {reg59?husband:wife}?

Ah! Vejo que você é do tipo romântico! Bem, fora os óbvios benefícios do amor, companheirismo e, humm, assuntos domésticos, casar entre a nobreza traz muitos trunfos. Você pode forjar uma forte aliança com a família da noiva, e uma esposa também pode ajudá-lo em manipular a política do reino de forma vantajosa.
What's more, most of the great families of the Northlands have at some point intermarried with royalty, which would boost your own claim to rule -- should you ever choose to assert it...

Ah! Vejo que você é do tipo romântica! Bem, fora os óbvios benefícios do amor, companheirismo e, humm, assuntos domésticos, casar entre a nobreza traz muitos trunfos. Você pode ter acesso à fortaleza e as propriedades do seu noivo, e pode trabalhar com ele para avançar sua posição no reino.

Every so often, a king or great lord of the Northlands will hold a feast. In towns, they will often be accompanied by tournaments. In castles, they will be accompanied by hunts. The feasts provide a chance for the lords to repair some of the rivalries that may undermine the strength of the realm. They also provide an opportunity for families to show off their eligible daughters, and ladies will often be allowed to mingle unsupervised with the guests.

Se tiver uma oportunidade, você pode tentar elogiar uma dama. Isso indicará a ela que você é um potencial pretendente, e ela decidirá se vai continuar aceitando mais elogios e, consequentemente, um cortejo. Se você se destacou em um torneio ou em uma caçada, então você pode causar uma melhor primeira impressão.

Para começar a cortejar uma dama demora um tempo e exige paciência, e alguns encontros em um período de alguns meses. Uma dama que estiver interessada em você sempre vai encontrar maneiras de fazer com que você seja comunicado de que ela gostaria de uma visita. Alternativamente você pode ir diretamente ao pai ou irmão dela e pedir permissão para encontrá-la. Se não tiver permissão do guardião dela, pode ainda ser possível conseguir um encontro através de outros meios.

Having arranged an assignment, you may then attempt to charm her and win her favor. Perhaps one of the most difficult aspects of this is finding a topic of conversation. Most noblewomen lead a cloistered life, at least until they are married, and thus will have little to say that will interest you. On other hand, she will soon tire of hearing of your own deeds in the outside world.

Um modo simples de cortejo é recitar um poema, e discuti-lo. Dessa maneira vocês dois estarão no mesmo pé e ninguém terá vantagem de conhecimento sobre o outro. É claro que damas tem diferentes gostos por poesia.

At some point, you will be able to discuss directly the issue of marriage. She will then let you know if you measure up to what she wants in a husband. Some ladies will coolly assess who is the most prestigious of her suitors, while others will be guided by their passions. Some will look to your companions, to see whether you are the kind of husband who will treat her as an equal, while others will follow the lead of their fathers.

At any rate, it is a challenging business -- and do not forget, you may find that your suit prospers with a lady, only to have it falter on a father's political ambitions. So you must ask yourself: are you willing to risk disappointment and heartbreak? Alternately, are you willing to throw away your standing in society, to make enemies of allies, in pursuit of a forbidden love? Because if you are, then perhaps someday we will write poems about you.
O que é que vocês poetas e músicos fazem mesmo?

Eu componho e escrevo músicas para os lordes dessa terra, e suas senhoras. Algumas vezes eu canto sobre a guerra, algumas vezes sobre virtudes de reis, e algumas vezes, para uma plateia mais sofisticada, sobre as virtudes do vinho. Genericamente, no entanto, eu canto sobre amor.
Não, isso é tudo?
Você teria outras questões?
Algo mais?
{reg59?My lady:My lord}, you look like a {reg59?lady:man} of the sword and someone who could help us. Will you hear my plea?
O que foi, meu bom homem?
What are you babbling about, peasant? Speak up.

A band of brigands has taken refuge in our village. They take everything we have, force us to serve them, and do us much evil. If one of us so much as breathes a word of protest, they kill the poor soul on the spot right away. Our lives have become unbearable. I risked my skin and ran away to find someone who can help us.
Por que você não foi falar com o lorde de sua vila? Ele poderia lidar com tais vermes.

I did, {reg59?my lady:my lord}, but our lord's men did not let me see him and said he was occupied with more important matters and that we should deal with our own problem ourselves. Please {reg59?my lady:my lord}, you look like a {reg59?lady:man} of valor and a fearsome warrior, and you have no doubt many friends and soldiers at your service. If there is anyone who can help us, it's you.
Muito bem, vou ajudá-lo. Onde fica essa vila?
Não tenho como fazer isso no momento.
Por que devo lutar com esses bandidos? O que eu ganho com isso?
God bless you, {reg59?lady:lord}. Our village is {s7}. It is not too far from here.
As you say, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. Forgive me for bothering you.

We are but poor farmers, {reg59?my lady:my lord}, and the bandits have already taken most of what we had in this world, but we'll be glad to share with you whatever we have left, and we'll always be in gratitude to you if you help us.
Thank you for helping us, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. Crush those bandits!
You seem somebody strong and accustomed to hard life. I am interested in recruiting you.
Sorry, I did not mean to bother you. Farewell.
Don't you see I am busy? I do not have time or inclination to join you.^^(You need 150 renown to recruit high-level troops).
We are traveling through these lands, but we might consider staying if you hire us, {reg59?madam:sir}. {reg3?Me and {reg4?{reg3} of my mates:one of my mates}:I} will join you for {reg5} peningas.
Any orders, {reg59?madam:sir}?
Preparem-se. Vamos partir ao alvoreçer.
Descanse. Ficaremos nessa cidade por um tempo.
Yes {reg59?madam:sir}. We'll be ready when you tell us to leave.
All right, I will hire you. Here are {reg5} peningas.
All right, but I can only hire {reg6} of you. Here are {reg5} peningas.
That sounds good, but I can't afford to hire any more men right now.
É uma pena. Bem, {reg3?nós estaremos:eu estarei} aqui por algum tempo, caso precise contratar alguém.
That sounds good, but I can't lead any more men right now.
Desculpe. Não preciso de mais homens no momento.
Be careful! I won't move until it's all over.
I will kill all the bandits, and you will be free.
Thank you, good {reg59?lady:sire}. I will never forget this!
Good day to you, {reg59?lass:lad}. The captain hired me to protect his ship. Here, on matters of defense, my word is the law.
I see. You must be the veteran. Can I learn about fighting from you?
Nice to meet you. I will be back later.

Indeed, you can. I don't have anything better to do while we aren't in combat! I can find you some opponents to practice with if you like. Or if you have any questions about theory of combat, feel free to ask.
As a matter of fact, I do have a few questions.
Na verdade, posso passar direto para a prática.
Bem, pergunte o que quiser.
Bom. É bom achar alguém que está ansioso para praticar. Vamos ver como se sai.
Foi uma boa luta.

Ha! Looks like you've developed a bit of a limp there. Don't worry. Even losses have their value, provided you learn from them. Shake the stars out of your eyes and get back in there. There's no other way to win.
Bom dia. Pront{o/a} para treinar um pouco hoje?
Well, are you ready for some training?
Estou pront{o/a} para treinar.
Primeiro, conte-me alguma coisa sobre combate...
Preciso partir agora. Adeus.
O que você quer saber?
O que mais você quer saber?
Tell me about combat.
I guess I know all theory I need. Let's talk about something else.

Boa pergunta. A primeira coisa que deveria saber como um lutador é como se defender. Ficar longe de coisas que podem te machucar é a primeira regra do combate, e é muito mais importante que ferir outros. Qualquer um pode brandir uma espada e cortar o que vier pela frente, mas poucos lutadores são peritos em defesa.

Agora. Defender-se é muito mais fácil se estiver equipado com um escudo. Apenas bloqueie com seu escudo [Aperte e segure o botão direito do mouse para se defender com o escudo.] Nesse estado, você será capaz de bloquear todos os ataques vindos da frente. No entanto, você ainda será atingido por golpes vindos dos lados ou das suas costas.
E se eu não tiver um escudo?

Then you will have to use your weapon to block your opponent. This is a bit more difficult than defending with a shield. Defending with a weapon, you can block against only ONE attack direction. That is, you block against either overhead swings, side swings or thrusts. Therefore, you must watch your opponent carefully and start to block AFTER he starts his attack. In this way, you will be able to block against the direction of his current attack. If you start to block BEFORE he makes his move, he may just attack in another direction than the one you are blocking against and score a hit.

Finally, Attacking is the best defence, they say. A tactic many fighters find useful is taking an offensive stance and readying your weapon for attack, waiting for the right moment for swinging it. [You can ready your weapon for attack by pressing and holding down the left mouse button.]
Isso parece útil.

É uma boa tática, mas lembre-se que, seu oponente pode ver isso e adotar uma postura defensiva contar a direção que você estiver visando. Se isso acontecer, você deve trocar de postura rapidamente e atacar por outra direção [Você pode cancelar seu ataque atual clicando rapidamente no botão direito].
Se meu oponente estiver defendendo na direção que irei atacar, eu irei trocar de posição.

Yes, selecting the direction you swing your weapon is a crucial skill. There are four main directions you may use: right swing, left swing, overhead swing and thrust. You must use each one wisely. [To control your swing direction with default controls, move your mouse in the direction you want to swing from as you press the left mouse button].
If I may say so, I see great warrior in you. ^^Some sailors have been idle since we stopped. Let's see if one of them could help us.
A sailor will fight you. Are you ready?
Sim estou.
Aqui vamos nós. Boa sorte.
Just a moment. I am not ready yet.
Hey, you will never make it if you don't practice.
Please, kind {reg59?madame:sir}, help us! I don't want to be a slave!
Hi {playername}. Glad to see you are alive. I thought you were killed when Sven Bull Neck's men attacked us. I was not so lucky, as you can see.
Bodo! What? Where is my mother? And who are these women?
Let me get you out of here, my friend, and then we'll talk.
We can't talk here; there are too many ears listening. Get me out of here, and I will tell you everything.
Please, kind {reg59?madame:sir}, help us. I don't want to be a slave.
Good day, {playername}. It is good to see that you are well. You were giving us a fright, talking in your sleep. I'd hate to be the one troubled by such dreams...
I'm fine, thank you. No one has need to worry.
Well, I can't see how my affairs are anyone else's business!
Perhaps not. At any rate, it's good to see you up and about, friend.
No need to get angry! I was just speaking as a friend. It's just good to see you up and about.
Remind me who you are. To tell the truth, my mind is still a little foggy.
Thanks! Now I'm going to help check out those ships. Farewell for now.
Why, I am Bodo. I hail from Cantabria, in the Kingdom of Asturias, in the north of the land that the Romans called Hispania. We've become well acquainted on this voyage.
Then I know you've told me your story, but I'd like to hear it again.
Oh, that's right... Bodo. Well, I go now to help check out those ships. Farewell for now.
Perhaps some other time. I think right now I want to keep an eye on the horizon. I'm not as convinced as the captain that stopping here is a good idea.
I thought I saw something a minute ago, but the mist over these waters plays tricks on the eyes... Probably nothing. I hope it's nothing. This ship's fast enough, but can't outrun a warship.
I'm worried as well. I'm glad you are watching, my friend.
What could be the harm of it? But to speed things along, I will help check out those ships.
And I'm glad to do it for you. We've become such good friends on this trip, I'm sorry we will soon part. If we meet again in the future and you need my help, you have it, my friend.
{s2}^^My {reg59?daughter:son}, it is such a nice day! The sea is so bright! It is truly a pity to have all these shipwrecks spoil the scene!
Yes, Mother. I'm glad you are well today.
You remember me? That's wonderful!
I will see you later, Mother.
{s2}^^Not only well but happy! I'm glad we made this trip, but we must remember to be home to make dinner! Your father will expect it.
{s2}^^You are my baby. I am your mother. Why would I or Father forget you?
But... Father is dead.
Mother, we are going home right now. I love you.
{s2}^^But... But... We aren't on a trip near home, are we? My head hurts so much, I don't remember where home is! I know who you are, but I don't remember your name. Am I crazy?
No, you've only forgotten a few things.
No, you're just sick. But soon we will see someone that will make you better.
Yes, but we're getting help for you. Farewell, then, for the moment.
{s2}^^Oh dear. I think I need a moment alone. Please go.
{s2}^^I am not so sure that anybody can heal this, my {reg59?daughter:son}.
We are almost there! Please don't give up now. We'll talk more later.
I'd like to chat, but I must complete my chores now.
Ic grete thee, {playername}. I'd like to chat, but I must complete my chores now. We will talk later.
Very well. We will talk tonight at the anchorage.
[Enemy lookouts watch you closely from the walls of Readingum.]
Talk to the boss, {playername}, that veteran in the prow of the boat over there. He's the one that can best train you in fighting.
Thanks, I will do that.
West thu hal, {playername}. Are you well today? You were moving violently in your sleep and saying incomprehensible things. My sailors thought you were being tormented by a spirit.
Where am I? What is this place?
Oh, this is bad. You don't remember anything? My name is Avo, leof. I am the captain of this ship, the Woden Ric. You embarked with us in Friese some weeks ago, paying well for us to take you on.
Yes, yes, I remember now.
Oh, it's coming back to me now, but perhaps you can remind me why am I here?
Well, don't worry. These things happen to everyone.

Now I'm really starting to worry about you. I don't know the details, but do know that you worry for your mother. She is sick, and you were taking her to a priest of great healing ability in the Frisian port where we are going.
Thanks! But it's light out. Shouldn't we be under full sail? The boat is not moving! What is happening? Why have we stopped?
May we talk later, {reg59?madame:sir}? I need to give some orders to my men.
Good day. We are ready to cast off. Are you ready?
I am ready. Please, let us continue our voyage.
No, I need to do something before we leave.
{s2}^^We've been together on this voyage some time. Would you like to try the rudder? She steers very nimbly for a merchantman.
Why, I've been wondering when you'd ask!
No. Believe me, I think you'd want me to touch it only a last resort!

We found a bit of wreckage, some half-sunken ships. Looks like there was a fight here recently. I have my men checking out the situation and looking for survivors. Poor bastards wouldn't have had a chance against Viking long ships. We'll be on our way soon enough, though.
Oh. Could we hurry it along? Whoever sunk those ships might still be nearby.
Well, finally a bit of excitement! I think I'll go and help them.
{s2}^^Relax, {reg59?woman:man}. Your friend, Bodo, insisted on keeping watch. I doubt that fellow ever misses a thing!
Bodo? Yes. Well, I'm still worried.
I sure hope you know what you're doing.
{s2}^^If you had been on one of those ships instead of this one, you'd want us to stop, now wouldn't you? It's the law of the sea -- especially this sea.
Be assured, I do, {reg59?madame:sir}. Now let me tend to this matter, or we'll be delayed even longer.
Oh, Woden, we're in trouble!
May we talk later, {reg59?madame:sir}? I need to give some orders to my men.
What's happened?

Shh! Keep quiet. Listen, we're in danger. As we were watching your fight, two long ships arrived. Now I can see the banner. It's Sven Bull-Neck. Ah, dammit! You'd better pray to whatever gods you worship. Hell, you may as well pray to those you don't! Won't matter at all if he catches us.
I knew this would happen! We should not have stopped.
Calm down, man! Tell me: who's Sven?
This is terrible news! What shall we do?

You've not heard of him? Sven's a Viking. Worse, a Viking's Viking. He burns villages and sinks ships and enslaves or kills everyone in them. Everyone! But it's worst for the one he chooses for a hideous death as a sacrifice to his gods. Heard of Blodorn, the Blood Eagle? You don't want to know what that means. Now keep quiet.
{s2}^^I think they're passing by. If we stay still right here, they may just think we're another bit of the wreckage. That's our only hope.
What? We should have already been escaping into the mist. Row, men, for all it's worth!
Please, calm down, my friend. We mustn't make a wrong move here!
{s1}^^Sven's spotted us! They're turning this way! Nothing for it but to move. Cut the anchor and start rowing! Oh, Woden, it's no use. Help!

Greetings! My name is Petro Didaz of Oveto, and I am a duke in the service of King Aldefonso of Asturias. These men are Silo, who comes from Farum in Gallaecia, and Gundinsalvo, who comes from Amaia, in Cantabria. We are surprised that you have submitted to us with so many ships and men. We want to know who you are.
My name is {playername}. I come on behalf of the sons of Ragnar to negotiate with you.
My name is {playername}. Aethelred, the king of West Seaxe, sends me to serve as your escort to his kingdom.
I do not think that's...
Ragnar's sons are powerful and well-known men. You should hear their proposal.
{s2}^^Yes, listen to their messenger. After he sings his song, we can kill him.
Rathbarth Ragnarsson wants you to join him and his brothers against West Seaxe.
Rathbarth Ragnarsson promises you half of West Seaxe if you join him.
Rathbarth Ragnarsson will fill your boat with riches if you join him.
And if they do not join, what will he do? Kill them? Did he send you here with a fleet to make friends?
Bodo?
Exactly. It is your choice.
If I wanted you dead, I would have attacked. I am offering an alliance with fellow winners.
{s2}^^I like things simple and clear. I like this guy.
Now you're talking.

This {reg59?woman:man} is a liar. I traveled with {reg59?her:him} for a long time. I offered {reg59?her:him} my friendship. I fought beside {reg59?her:him} and served {reg59?her:him} faithfully. But when the time came, {reg59?she:he} betrayed me and delivered the letter to the Vikings. That's why {reg59?she:he} is here today with that fleet: to destroy you and the alliance between West Seaxe, Frankia and Asturias.
The Danish rule the North. It will take an alliance to keep Asturias safe.
West Seaxe is weak and ripe for conquest. Don't you want to enjoy the glory and loot?
I didn't come this far to listen to this nonsense. What is your decision?

That has been my position for some time now. Better Danmark than West Seaxe. The Danish control practically all the north while West Seaxe barely controls its own kingdom. An alliance with the Danish would mean that the Vikings would stay away from Asturias. Maybe we could even use them against Al-Andalus.
What? Then all the fun would end. I like killing Vikings and keeping their boats.

Someone who truly knows the north would not say that. The king of the Danish does not have the power to control the Vikings. The Vikings are free men who have embraced the sea to get wealth and fame, and if their king tried to stop them, they would find another king.
West Seaxe can still fight, and I think it would be quite good at it. You sing well, messenger. It would be nice to switch our looting to places other than the lands of the Moors.
Well, this sounds good to me.
You're forgetting that our king has an alliance with the king of West Seaxe. Is it your intention to disobey your king?
Do not be deceived by {reg59?her:his} flattering words. Anyone who pays attention to {reg59?her:him} ends badly.
Are you listening to {reg59?her:him}? Makes demands like a king, and if they are not accepted, threatens with the sword.
Bodo is a good man, but he will lead you to destruction if you listen to him.
It's time for you to make a decision.
There was a time that I loved and admired you. You tricked me, and I will never forgive you. The day will come when you will die by my hands.
I have already expressed my opinion. My men will join the sons of Ragnar and make an alliance with the Danish in favor of Asturias. King Aldefonso will be satisfied.
I did not bleed for a kingdom destined to perish. I'm with Silo. Join the Danish and ransack West Seaxe.
I would prefer killing Danes rather than Saxons... Yes, that's my decision.
King Aldefonso named me, his duke, lord of this army, to complete our mission of helping West Seaxe. Barring orders to the contrary, that is our goal, and anything else is treason.

Your people cannot be trusted, Duke Petro. I am Bodo Vimaraniz from Malacoria. You know me, I am a man of the royal court, and here is my seal. I did not want to resort to this...^^I am the word of the king here. I have given an order to have the West Seaxe fleet attack {playername}'s fleet. Look over there and enjoy the show!

Silo is a traitor and will be executed. Gundinsalvo will gather and embark his Cantabrians now and prepare for battle. You, Petro, will leave some men here to protect our food supply and send the rest with Gundinsalvo. {playername} shall return to {reg59?her:his} ship to die with {reg59?her:his} men. We will advance from here with our ships in a pincer attack and end this matter. Then we will travel in aid of West Seaxe as agreed.
You are not the king, and you have ordered an attack without our consent. This breaks all the rules. I'm going with {playername}, but I will not fight.
Bodo, you're stupidly crazy! You're sending these men to their death.
See you soon.
Away with {playername}! Everyone must prepare for battle. Gundinsalvo, go with your men, but if you happen to betray us, you will pay dearly!
Welcome {playername}, we expected you days ago.
The king of West Seaxe sent a nobody. That is an insult!
{s2}^^You get offended too easily, Silo.
This man next to me, Bodo, is from Asturias.
How many men and boats do you have?
{s2}^^Hah! I like someone who gets straight to the point.
Thank you, {playername}, but Petro knows who I am. He has seen me in the royal court. I am one of the king's men, as my seal shows.

They have more than 500 men and more than 20 boats, many of them obtained from the defeated Danish, {playername}. Petro knows me. He has seen me in the royal court. I am one of the king's men, as my seal shows.
Yes, I'm glad to see you, Bodo. It has been many years.
True, but now you know where I have been. This alliance between West Seaxe, Asturias and Frankia is my work.
Glad to see this meeting of old friends.
Well, before we leave, we have to talk about that man, Silo.
Very diplomatic, but we have to tackle a thorny issue. Silo has been providing information to the Danish.
What! What are you talking about?

Sigurd Ragnarsson mentioned his name when he spoke to {playername} about a traitor in Asturias who's been sending them information regularly. So Sigurd knew about the letter and my movements. He also knows about this fleet now.
Everything he says is true.
Silo should die now.
(Dizer nada)
What? You judge and condemn me merely based on the word of this stranger, mere riffraff? By God! I have a noble rank!
Kill him? This is a bit hasty, don't you think?
You should fear what I have to say more than anything else.

Bodo's word means considerably more to me than any other proof or witness. However, we are not in the position to judge or condemn, for that is the king's prerogative. Silo, if you are a traitor, pray God to protect you, for the king won't have mercy. For now, you will be imprisoned and sent back to Asturias with the witness, {playername}, while we will continue on to West Seaxe.
Very well, I will go to Asturias to testify against this man, Silo.
Sorry, I can't go to Asturias. I have an unfinished business back in Englaland.

I think no one is going anywhere. If I'm not mistaken, that smoke you see on the horizon comes from our guest's ships. It seems that the Danish have arrived. Maybe now you would understand my strategy.
By the gods! Sorry, I mean my God! Both fleets are maneuvering for battle. The smoke comes from fire arrows.
You must have the eyes of an eagle, Cantabro. We must help our allies before the Danes destroy them. Silo, we need your men on our side, they are the best sailors in our fleet.
You should've thought of that before making grave accusations. My men will fight with me... Well, the Danish brought more boats, and I always ally with the winner.

You traitorous scum! I am taking the overall command. {playername}, return to your ships and try to contain the Danish. Gundinsalvo will be in charge of our fleet and will join you. I'll stay here in a safe place to coordinate a defense on the ground, so that you have a place to withdraw to if things go bad.^^Go!
You're insane! You should surrender. To me, my men! For Gallaecia!

Good day to you {reg59?lass:lad}. You look like another adventurer who has come to try {reg59?her:his} chance in these lands. Well, trust my word. You won't be able to survive long here unless you know how to fight yourself out of a tight spot.
Thank you for your advice. This place looks like a training field. Can I learn about fighting here?
